Reviews.Title: “Not paradise but fine for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: makybes
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night after a delayed flight (at the airlines expense). Room and service was fine with the food delivered on room service being very nice. The lack of pay tv channels in English was odd but if you want to watch Asian news or game shows there is heaps of channels to choose from

Reviews.Title: “Place to Stay when flying in late or leaving Early”
Reviews.Author: barrindp
Reviews.Content: Smart Clean Efficient business hotel - what you expect - live on the south coast of NSW and always head to Sydney the day before flying out. Love the fast check in - normally have meetings to get to - so check in and leave the bags with the conceirge (I don't have time to go the room). By the time I have finished meetings etc in the city my bags are are nicely in the room. Find the staff friendly and efficient - they understand that most people who are arriving or leaving from the airport have had enough of queues - or are in a hurry to get to their next destination.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: caperata
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, comfortable, large rooms. Expensive, but they all are in this area. Nice big outdoor pool in the sun. The spa was mediocre and did not feel clean. Good exercise equipment. Breakfast costs a fortune, find better food and prices a short walk north on Riordan St, at the Mascot Airport Carwash Cafe. They will make your breakfast exactly the way you like it!

Reviews.Title: “Decent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: YassSaluqi
Reviews.Content: Everything in the room worked well and was clean. Staff businesslike but polite, room service menu was more varied than many similar hotels with an additional Singaporean menu to the usual club sandwiches, steak and pasta. I am Australian so had my own wireless internet and mobile, the phone and internet charges did look steep. I also noticed that the shuttle services to the airports were pay services, I chose to walk to the Domestic terminal from the hotel and catch the train to the International Terminal where my business meetings were. I would stay here again and catch the train rather than stay at the Mercure which isn't as clean or quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, but overprice”
Reviews.Author: chanplc
Reviews.Content: Rooms are bigger than those in the city, staff are helpful but hotels' Internet package was twice the amount I paid in a 4* hotel in the city. Somehow F&B service is slow (waited for a long time @ it's restaurant for our order to arrive but the food tasted alright) . There is a convinient store and a bar next door.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for airport”
Reviews.Author: goswanniez
Reviews.Content: Good location for airport, room was ok nice and clean. Reception staff let the hotel down, unfriendly at check in and rude at check out. Breakfast nice but not worth the $34.00 per person they charge for it. Wouldn't stay again due to reception staff, room was fine but rudeness is unacceptable at any hotel let alone a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: baytravellers
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here before leaving for the USA. The hotel is an excellent location for a good sleep close to the airport. There is no airport noise due to the thick glass used for the rooms. We booked the dinner/bed/breakfast deal and found it perfectly adequate. Dinner was a set Asian noodle dish and breakfast was a buffet with plenty of the usual choices. The hotel has an outdoor pool and a well equipped gym. Our room was spacious, well equipped, traditional furniture and all in good condition. We found it very comfortable. The hotel is an easy walk from the domestic terminal but to get to the international we needed to use the shuttle - at $6 per person this is rather pricey - definitely use a cab if there are more than two of you. The disadvantage of an airport hotel is of course that there is little to do in the immediate area. If you are looking at longer than an overnight stay I would prefer to choose a city hotel and travel out to the airport but for airport convenience and quality, the Stamford would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Convenient to Airport”
Reviews.Author: JohnDeere63
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel directly at the airport upon our arrival from Melbourne before leaving for the U.S. the next morning. There is an airport conceirge in the domestic terminal opposite luggage carousel 3. Then you exit the terminal to your left and walk around the curve and across the small lane to wait for a Super Shuttle bus that will take you to your hotel. The cost of the bus ($6.00 AUS pp) will be added to your bill at the hotel. The hotel itself was clean and neat. There was a bellman to help with our luggage. Check-in took a bit longer because the computer system wasn't keeping up to the reservation system. Our room was large and comfortable and our wake up call was efficient. There was nothing remarkable about the room - a standard, clean airport hotel (but it was quiet). There was a seperate tub and shower in a large bathroom. There was a hot pot for tea or coffee. We had planned to eat a combination lunch/dinner at about 4:30, but the dining room didn't open until 6:00. We walked about 3 blocks to a McDonald's to fill our void, but next door was a Krispy Kreme doughnut shop for a little 'reward'. We signed up for the 7:10 Super Shuttle to the Int'.l airport the next morning, and it arrived before 7, so get to the lobby early. The buses pull a trailer, so there is plenty of room for passengers and luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, not special”
Reviews.Author: thetraveldoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before catching AM flight overseas. Room acceptable amount of space, bathroom, cleanliness. Dinner was decent Asian fare. Maitre D seemed totally nervous about not signing bill. Internet very expensive - 55 cents/ min! Breakfast was average, nothing special. Positives: convenient; in fact can easily walk from Domestic terminal. Clean. Quiet. Negatives: expensive Internet; shuttle not free (6$ pp). Think ordinary holiday inn type airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: susanna142
Reviews.Content: The Stamford Plaza is the nicest airport hotel amongst the others close to the domestic terminals. It is only five minutes or so to the international terminal. I stay here for both business travel and a night prior/after an international flight before connecting to Canberra. The hotel provides a shuttle service to the airport for about $6.00 which is so much better than dealing with cranky cab drivers who moan about the small fare. Check-in staff are courteous, friendly and accommodating to requests. When I was unhappy with one particular room it was switched immediately and with no fuss. The rooms are comfortable and clean and have TV, tea/coffee making facilities, ironing facilities and plenty of hanging space in the wardrobe. The bathroom is ample in size, has a hairdryer and good quality bath amenities. Air conditioning is quiet. Room service menu can be hit and miss (depending on what you order I suppose) but is delivered within the time stated. The breakfast buffet is extensive with hot and cold selections and is constantly being replenished, therefore everything is fresh. There is also a less formal and relaxed bar/cafe adjacent to the lobby. As a repeat customer I am happy to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: mollingaround
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on the way somewhere else (der). Got a great room price on Wotif. The room was peaceful, quiet and relaxing, and all the facilities were perfectly fine. Service was pleasant, checking in and out was uneventful. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant, it was fine, and there were some decent Asian meals on the menu. Service in the restaurant was very friendly. Would stay here again for sure. If you need to chill out before or after a flight, this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Airport hotel can't be faulted”
Reviews.Author: AussieChook
Reviews.Content: I stayed here again (3rd visit) in March for one night. Check-in was fast (I luckily avoided an air crew just coming in after me which would have slowed it all down) and the room was clean, comfortable and quiet, bathroom was spotless with nice amenities. Room service for breakfast was efficient and delivered on time. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel for a stopover. The shuttle service leaves every half an hour from the domestic terminal, roughly on the hour or half hour, and cost about $6 one way, this is added to your hotel bill for payment on check-out. The hotel is about 5 minutes from the airport and is walkable if you don't mind the busy roads. I'll be back again in October

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but average”
Reviews.Author: Jane M
Reviews.Content: This is a very average property, the best thing about it is how close it is to the airport. The front desk area feels a bit cramped and does get packed at times. The rooms are a reasonable size and the bathrooms are spacious, but the furnishings are quite worn in places. The bed had a big dip in the mattress and wasn't particularly comfortable. The room service food was pretty awful, as it has been every time I've stayed. The soundproofing is good, I really didn't hear the airport noise and could barely hear a train passing right below my window. Rooms on the higher floors on the airport side have fantastic views of the airport runways. Convenient if you want to be close to the airport but certainly no great shakes.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: goddesslozza
Reviews.Content: I wish I could rate this hotel higher but for the number of stars they claim this to be it isn't worth the money. Yes I know I'm a bit fussy but this hotel was horrible. It was super busy the foyer with 20 air attendants either checking in or checking out and it was chaos. Not a great start. The room itself looked liked something 20 years ago. The walls were marked, furniture outdated. The bed was so hard it was horrible. The alarm clock's buttons didn't work, which was not great since it was an airport hotel and we were relying on it to wake us up. The only positive were the guys who helped bring out bags up they were super helpful and funny. Would I stay or recommend .. NO. I'll try Rydges next time since it's only across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Petracca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy walking distance from the domestic terminal. It's a 'nice' hotel with nothing out of the ordinary to boast about. Perfect place to stay if you have an early international flight out the next day. The hotel provides a shuttle service to the international airport, but you do need to book and do need to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: JeanHH
Reviews.Content: Catch the shuttle to/from the airport. Very luxurious room. Quiet. Great staff. King size bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pete_Helen_Lucy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as part of a business trip. Hotel is very close to the airport, but not right on the airport concourse so a taxi or bus/shuttle transfer is required. The room was fine and the bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for travellers and a clean and tidy hotel which covers most needs”
Reviews.Author: Holymanic
Reviews.Content: Looking for somewhere affordable to stay in most major capital cities in Australia is becoming a problem, and Sydney is no exception. It seems we have the option of high end (and high cost) 5 Star at one extreme and shared accommodation at a backpackers at the opposite end of the scale. So when I had to make a quick business trip to Sydney recently I wanted somewehere with a few creature comforts that didn't cost the earth and Stamford Plaza Sydney Airport looked like a good option. I must say it didn't disappoint (I hate it when you search for accommodation, rely on reviews and hotel photos and turn up to a place that's a real dive). This hotel is extremely conveniently located right near the domestic terminal (but a little too far to walk especially in drizzling rain). I hired a car (not just to get there but for getting to and from my meetings) at Sydney airport and headed over to the hotel. I was warmly welcomed, provided with a temporary parking spot near the front door free of charge and ushered to the check in counter. I was give a free room upgrade to a bigger room on the top floor from where I had a magnificent view over the airport and Botany Bay beyond. The room was suprisingly quiet (obviosly much thought had been given to the glazing). The decore is a little dated (not new and trendy, but warm and comforting). It was extremely clean and offered everything I needed in a spacious room. The king size bed was comfortable and the bathroom relatively large for a hotel and well laid out with all the nice little features you would expect. On my bedside table were two complimentary bottles of water and nearby were tea and coffe making facilities and a well stocked mini bar. As this was a short trip I didn't have time to try room service, but the menu looked good and covered a good range of dishes. I felt extremely comfortable in this hotel and would not hesitate to return. It offered a shuttle service to both the international and domestic airports and parking on site. The check out was fast and efficient and everyone of the staff I met made me feel welcome and were extremely friendly. Overall a good experience and good value for money in what is often an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: mina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. The hotel room was ok however the service was bad in the restaurant and in general the staff were not very helpful. Our meals were forgotten about for an hour and our entree dim sims where there was 5 tiny dim ssim the size of a 20 cent pieces cost $17, So my suggestion stay here but dont use the restuarant in the lobby. Although I think the rooms are a little overpriced and then the shuttle isnt complementary either. We have had better stays at cheaper airport hotels in Sydney in the past. Wouldnt stay here again will try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect few nights for airport travel”
Reviews.Author: Kellukey
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights before & after our overseas travel. We found it great especially with a baby, great & friendly staff/service. Easy to check in & out. We could just hear the airplanes if you really listen but compared to outside noise very quite.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport but....”
Reviews.Author: Mark A
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly. Check in can be slow and the staff a bit "distracted". Rooms are ok but a bit dated and starting to show their age. The lobby restaurant is not great - really bad coffee and food that is often cool/cold (breakfast). The real upside is its very close to the airport with regular shuttles to the airport ( extra cost). Would I stay there if it wasn't so close to the airport... Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice hotel but needs more attention to details”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTourist
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with Wotif secret hotel because we were catching early flight at the international airport. This hotel has been around for a long time thus some parts look a bit tired and needs TLC. Location: It's walking distance to the domestic airport and 5 minute drive to the international airport. Hotel provides shuttle bus to the airports. There is a pub next to the hotel and McDonald's, Crispy Creme Donuts are within walking distance. Room: The room we were given was spacious with large bathroom and a view to the city. It's clean. I agree with lack of attention in the amenities in the room in terms of in room tea and coffee provided. Staff are friendly and efficient. The only other complaint I had was the noise insulation is not as satisfactory. We could hear neighbours opening and closing the doors early hours in the morning. Overally, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel marred by lack of attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Greynurse
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice hotel, but a sense of economising on little things. Examples: in-room tea & coffee but no herbal tea, hot chocolate sachet or complimentary bottle of water. Hole in towel, fork with bent prongs, no towels provided in spa. Spa water a funny colour, not sure why but a bit distasteful. No tea & coffee at lunch - & when I asked was told to go over to ask for tea at bar area despite my having an obvious post surgery limp. Long wait at dinner for a salad - it had been overlooked, waitstaff not very attentive. Very quiet, attractive room. Toilet paper holder fell off wall.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bindip61
Reviews.Content: Shuttle bus was at bus stop at timetabled time. Bit of a hike to bus stop with luggage from international airport so use a trolley even if your luggage has wheels. Speedy checkin. Room very comfy. Tea and coffee facilities, mini bar etc.Good aircon. Nice bathroom. Only thing missing from room was a bathrobe which would gave been nice. In room wifi and breakfast as part of deal. Normally wifi 0.55 cents per min up to $29 max for 24 hours. This is a major gripe with me in hotels. Wifi should be free and this is extremely expensive compared to other international airport hotels and given the tariff which is not cheap. Nice food. Have stayed here s couple of times and would recommend as very good transit hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Delight to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Walleroobie
Reviews.Content: I am definitely not one to give high ratings on hotels but this hotel deserves a 9/10. I have stayed here many times and not been disappointed. I was very pleased with response to special reqests especially extended book out time. I no longer complete survey forms of hotels because in over 40 years of travel no hotel has ever responded to any suggestions or complaints (whether by form or direct complaint at reception) and I am firmly convinced that they simply go into a bin. However many good managers respond to "tripadvisor" so it is apparent that they do react to suggestions via this medium so with that in mind I make comment, with the very best of intentions, on minor matters requiring improvement: 1. The hotel was chosen mainly because of its convenient access to the airport and previous good experience, however, taxi drivers, can be highly rude when they discover you have only a short trip (my tip: please jot down their details and report a complaint on the web) so my wife & I decided to use the shuttle bus - we arrived at the bus stop at 6.10 pm and the hotel at 7.00pm...any 'convenience' advantage was well-and-truly lost! 2. After this annoyance and arrival at the hotel, reception was excellent and we were in our room as quick as a flash; settled in; changed to casual dress; then discovered the phone was out of order...we couldn't order in-room dinner! So dressed again to go downstairs to reception and report the matter. The technician did arrive quickly and addressed the matter but by the time we received our dinner it was after 9.00pm...again , any 'convenience' advantage lost. The meal however was exceptional and worth the wait! 3. "Dooners" - the bane of my life...I assume hotels use them because of convenience and speed for cleaners and bed-making but surely any cost advantage is lost through having to turn the air conditioning onto cool/cold? Bring back sheets and blankets! 4. At a time when every dam in the country is overflowing and the countryside is soaked and flooded we have signs calling for less use of water and showers that have little pressure ...go figure! Overseas guests surely can only wonder at this madness! The only advantage I can see is cost saving for the hotel in water rates! 5. With a group of clients from across the country I was anxious to impress so the pre-dinner drinks session was important - unfortunately, the very fiendly bar man did not know his drinks and got our orders mixed up five times. These orders were not difficult - reisling received instead of 'bubbly', etc. 6. For dinner we had pre-requested a-la-carte but all were directed to the buffet. Personally I thought this the best seafood / buffet I have enjoyed in a long time as did others but I did have to handle complaints from some of my clients. I would have chosen the buffet in any event. These criticisms are not intended to deter any potential guest from staying ...this is an excellent hotel and hopefully management will take note and act on the matters I have raised. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlafBM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights (Feb 11 to Feb 18). It is conveniently located just few minutes away from the airport and also not far away from the Mascot business district. The airport shuttle bus is unfortunately not complimentary. Mascot Train Station is within a walking distance. Some of the rooms do not have a safety box although it is advertised in every room. The rooms not facing the airport are more quiet and give a great view over the city (if you are in an upper floor room). Be careful not to get a room opposite to the service rooms, because such area is noisy early morning, latet at night - whenever rooms need to be prepared (usually most of the time at an airport hotel). Breakfast at the restaurant - variety not wide enough when staying 6 nights; glasses and cutlery not always clean; friendly and unfriendly staff. Checkout: I was very happy that I was offered by the concierge to use the Hospitality Lounge after I had checked out - refreshing shower, changing clothes, having a coffee and taking a rest while waiting for the airport bus.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel - close to Sydney Airport”
Reviews.Author: Greg041965
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay overnight in the Stamford Hotel at Sydney Airport. We attended a family birthday for our 90 year old aunty at nearby suburb Kingsford, so the location was handy. We also went by cab to Darling Harbour at night with visiting family, the fare being a little over $30.00 each way. My wife and I stayed in 'valentines package' which was well within our budget and included free parking and a full buffet breakfast. The room was spacious and tastefully appointed, whilst the breakfast was superb and good quality. The staff were friendly and helpful. We could not hear any noise from the nearby airport (the domestic terminal is two blocks away), nor any traffic noise. We would stay again at the Stamford.

Reviews.Title: “lovely reception staff!!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaandMaurice
Reviews.Content: stayed here as a stop over between domestic and international flights. It was a good location nice and close to the airport and handy for early morning international flights. When we arrived we were very impressed with the reception staff. They were friendly and very helpful. Was more than happy with our room but I agree with Tinkerbell, a buffet breakfast included would have made the stay near perfect! The only negative I had was when we went for a drink at the bar, the bartender wasn't friendly and never smiled the whole time we were there. Apart from that we will stay there again when we are travelling with our international flights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell890
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the hotel before a long haul flight. Once again everything was up to the standard we expected. The only disappointment that the deal didn't include breakfast like last year as we were staying on the 1st of Feb and the deal was up to the end of Jan. Would of just made life a little easier if we could of had breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Great sport for an overnight.”
Reviews.Author: BarryandBarb
Reviews.Content: Really quiet in spite of location. Nice room with everything that we needed

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ian s
Reviews.Content: whilst travelling I worked in this hotel for 3 months and I found it to be an excellent hotel. I worked in the Grove and the bar. The food was always fresh on the buffet and was refreshed on a regular basis. The rooms while I was there were to a very high standard and I would stay in this hotel myself if I was ever back in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at Reception”
Reviews.Author: Magictarakan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Stamford Hotel and on my way to hotel I misplaced my newly bought camera in the Taxi. The reception and Managers were thorough professionals and helped me track the taxi. Job done very well. I will definately recommend and will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport, Service at Front Desk, leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: DaffyAustralia
Reviews.Content: I checked in at nearly 11pm and told the front desk that I had forgotten my toothbrush. I asked if the Convenience store located outside the hotel was still open so that I can buy a toothbrush. I was asked to check it out myself, which I did. The shop was closing and I went back to inform the receptionist. I asked if I could have a toothbrush and it was given to me from behind the front desk area. I feel that, I should not have been asked to go check if the convenience store was still open and I should have been offered a toothbrush in the first place. Not up to standard customer service, staff needs training.

Reviews.Title: “A Night at the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Vidoro
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay overnight close to Sydney's domestic airport, the Stamford Plaza is a good choice. You can walk there from the terminal in about 10-15 minutes (depending on your luggage load and level of fitness!) or wait for the hotel's bus which does the circuit about every 35-40 minutes (subject to traffic which can get pretty horrendous). The staff are used to dealing with weary jet-lagged travellers and maintain a welcoming smile and pleasant disposition even in the face of some very rude and uncouth customers. The hotel was previously a Sheraton and the rooms are 1980s era Sheraton with a few updates (eg flat-screen TV - still hidden in the old-style TV cupboard). The restaurant is combined with the bar and can get pretty noisy when a boisterous crowd of conference delegates are in residence. The cuisine is heavily influenced by the present Singaporean ownership, which is great if you like Singapore-style Asian food. My seafood laksa was excellent and very filling - don't order any additional courses unless you're feeling particularly gluttonous. I had a "continental" breakfast which was very basic but unusually cheap ($12). It fulfilled all my usual breakfast needs - fruit juice, cereal, fresh fruit and yoghurt, toast and a cup of tea. The conference rooms are made up of a very large space subdivided by portable screens into smaller rooms, which provides great flexibility but you can hear the adjacent venue speakers which is a bit disconcerting for your own speaker and audience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Cocobean8
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel during an overnight layover. I was upgraded from to a deluxe room, I had no idea this had happened until I stepped into the elevator and saw the rooms on my level marked deluxe. It was a nice surprise to find a large room with a view straight into the airport (itâ€™s nicer than it sounds). I was prepared for the $29/24 hour internet surcharge, what I was not prepared for was how bad the connection would be. I had to give up on wireless about five minutes into the session when it suddenly decided not to load any pages, and even with the cable connection I found myself frequently being redirected to the log on/t&c page. Considering the massive premium paid for internet access (which in this day and age should be free- especially in a hotel that likes to market itself as corporate friendly), the level of service was unacceptable. Room service was fairly quick and the server polite, the item I ordered was only $2 more than if I had gone down to the bar to order (excluding gratuity). Check in and check out were a breeze. Shuttle bus to and from the airport is charged to your room, no need to pay the driver. If you donâ€™t have many bags and are travelling to or from the domestic airport, save yourself the $6 each way (and the time waiting for the bus) and walk. The concierge said it is about 15 minutes, I think it would actually be quicker than that (I didnâ€™t do it because I had too many bags). Overall, I found the hotel and rooms perfectly suitable. It is expensive to stay here, unfortunately that is the case with most Sydney Airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: aussie_travellers_90
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the domestic airport and just diwn the road from the international airport. The rooms are a good size and the staff are friendly and helpful. There is a free shuttle between the hotel and the airport terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SHBBB
Reviews.Content: Good stay if arriving into Sydney for a short time and you need somewhere to spend the night and dont intend to go into town. Shuttle busnto the Airport. On the way to the hotel best jump in a taxi, much easier then looking for the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you don't expect too much on the services”
Reviews.Author: Aviator42
Reviews.Content: I stay here for 1 nite due to business meetings. I did not have high expectations of the place, but nevetheless was disappointed with the service provided by the staff. The room itself doesn't even come with complete amenities like toothbrush, bedroom slippers etc. I have to call the housekeeping to get this, and coming in at around 10pm at nite, nobody even took my call. i was transferred to the reception and the reception told me that they have to check to see if they have it. Oh come on, these are the basic neccessities if you are running a hotel right? After that, while I was in a shower, they left the items outside the doorstep, not even bothering to come back a second time to deliver the items. Shocking. Room service was bad, the folks manning the line needs some serious training on how to be polite to customers. I thought surely that housekeeping was bad, but didn't expect the same service level from a profit centre. The only thing that I can remember from the call was that the lady insisted that it would take at least 30mins for them to send the meal up. Fine. After that, I found out that I need an international adapater and called the reception, she ask me to come down to the reception front desk and collect it myself. Wow! Well, all in all, I would not stay here again and I think the service staff really ought to be train better to remain competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: squishy_9
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonable airport hotel but it's rooms need a little work, the wall paper is peeling in the bathrooms and there was a few marks on the wall. The downstairs cafe is overpriced, but the range is ok. The parking was easy to find and there is a restaurant strip and short walk away. No free internet either,

Reviews.Title: “Definately expected more for a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: smeezeme
Reviews.Content: After staying at a few 4 star hotels recently I was definately expecting more for the star ratings as well as the price. The service upon check in was okay altho the bell boys could be a bit more interested in helping with peoples bags. The room we stayed in seems very dated for the 21st century and the inside of our toilet bowl was cracked. It could also use some room freshners as when we entered each time you were walking into a musty smelled room. We decided that we would have dinner in the grove resurant and I have to say this was the most dissapointing for us both. Meals are badly overpriced for what you get, I was expecting more on my plate for $30 !!!! the salad was HOTT, tasted like it had been sitting on the bench for quite a while, the tomato was HOTT .. didnt touch it and pushed this to the side. Not sure if we will stay here again for our future travels. The mecure up the road looks more appealing for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the price”
Reviews.Author: GCake1105
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid and the fact that this was a Stamford, I expected a lot more. It was nice but it seems like the furniture in the room would have been really nice if we had stayed there 20 years ago. It could use a good renovation. It was located really close to the domestic terminal and maybe a 5-10 min. drive from the int'l terminal. The taxi driver was really mad and actually cursed because he had been waiting for a much higher fare customer. Anyways, the location was great because we had an early morning flight, but since the airport/hotel are located not too far from central Sydney, it was about a 25 AUD taxi drive to downtown to see Chinatown and the Opera house. Internet is not free anywhere in the entire hotel, again, a big disappointment for a Stamford hotel, but it seems to be the norm in Australia. The concierge was more like the bell man who gives out very basic information. The room itself was clean, no complaints about noise or anything. Our room did not have a view, there's nothing much to look at except ugly suburb and maybe the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, lack of organisation”
Reviews.Author: tweetypie85
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times. The last two times has been really disappointing & it will e our last time. We go to the Stamford for our Anniversaries/Special Occasions, where we usually grab one of the 'Romantic packages' or similiar. We booked an 'Airport view' deluxe room, we received a City view standard room. I went to Reception & asked to be moved, they put us in a corner room & we still did not feel we had the right room. We had 'High Tea' in the Restaurant/Bar which was the highlight of the stay. It was delicious & really well done, great selection. The worst part of the stay, was at about 7:30/8am the next morning we were woken by Housekeeping! My partner yelled out "No". Then about 30mins later, another knock at the door - it was a guy wanting to check the 'Mini-bar', we again had to yell out "No" so that they would not enter the room. Very disappointing for what is a pricey place to stay. We will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “over priced but great location for airport travellers”
Reviews.Author: jetsetterzrgo
Reviews.Content: its good in a pinch but REALLY needs some TLC ..... old and tired but rooms are roomy and beds comfy.

Reviews.Title: “G'day Stay”
Reviews.Author: dreamdestinations
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night so we could be close to the airport for our international flight. It took us a while to find a shuttle to the hotel but we were greeted warmly by the staff and checked in prompty (always a plus). The hotel is well maintained and our room was good size, neat and clean. The bathroom was spotless with generous towels. We arrived late but had a light meal and drink in the restaurant next to the hotel. The hotel's restaurant offered a nice variety of food for breakfast the next day. The front desk arranged our transfer to the airport (very close to both international and domestic airports) for our departure. We were very satisfied with our stay here and we would highly recommend this property and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Jet Lag Recovery”
Reviews.Author: Denis9
Reviews.Content: After the long flight from UK we arrived at the hotel at 7.30am. We waited in a lounge area (complimentary drinks, shower, TV etc) and then shown to a upgraded room. After a nice sleep we enjoyed an asian themed evening meal and a quite night. Next morning, after a good breakfast we were ready to enjoy all that Sydney had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Park n Fly”
Reviews.Author: Oldandnew
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before & have always managed to find a good deal. This time we chose the Park and fly option which really worked out so convenient. Quite a competitively priced parking option with the hotel handy to both airports & the free shuttle. Rooms are very comfortable, really puts you in a holiday mood to stay in a lovely room right at the very start of the holiday. Restaurant serves a good selection of international cuisine. Only complaint - checkout was too slow, not enough staff & of course I always choose the wrong queue!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with nice rooms but needs some improvement on pricing and service”
Reviews.Author: OL1981
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel under a Wotif Secret Stays deal. I have rarely been disappointed with the result and this is no exception! The lobby/foyer interior of this hotel looks very nicely decorated and modern as you'd expect from an upscale hotel but still has a kind of down-to-earth style that makes it quite appealing. Being so close to the airport it is obviously a magnet for airline crews since I saw a considerable number of member of flight people -particularly from Malaysia Airlines there. The airport shuttle is nice and convenient , although some would argue with the $6 fee imposed when a lot of airport hotels have complimentary shuttles but no real big deal. The hotel is not particularly close to any of Sydney's major attractions but is convenient to stay presumably for a transit hotel for the short term The rooms are clean, comfortable, spacious, warm, welcoming and nicely furnished with at least a few of them offering breathtaking views of the city/surrounding area that are rare to find for this price. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept in. It had all the luxuries and amenities you'd expect from a hotel of this calibre, although the mini-bar needs to have a more diverse selection of foods (the choice of beverages are great though!) The bathroom is nice -although the bath area is a little small -and there are a great number of nice shower/bathing amenities provided for by the hotel which are a nice little touch -and the cleaning staff do a great job! Due to the double glazing on the windows, the noise from the aircraft is minimal and you can be assured of a peaceful sleep. The room temperature is very easy to set here -which I am thankful for, considering the struggles I've had at some hotels -and so thus it made it easy to get the room temperature right! The rooms are slightly dark due to their colors and could do with a bit more lighting but nevertheless they have a pleasant ambience and I had a nice experience despite it taking quite a while to settle in for some reason) and it was a pleasure to stay here. I'd recommend this hotel for the rooms and the breathtaking views alone. The restaurant has a nice ambience to it and, both here and on the room service menu, the hotel offers delightful cuisine options that include both Malaysian/Singaporean and western dishes. All the dishes I sampled from this cuisine were absolutely delicious so compliments to the chef. The restaurant staff at dinner were very attentive and helpful, less so at breakfast. I do commend this hotel for its initiatives to help the environment and conserve on resources which are quite groundbreaking and innovative. There is room for improvement in a few areas. Firstly, something really needs to be done about the room keys! They seem to malfunction at the slightest whim and I had my room key fail to work four times in less than one day (including twice in less than five minutes! and the second time after the staff had fixed the problem the first time!),. Obviously the room keys are over-sensitive to exposure or something like that because I've rarely had so many problems with a room key! Secondly the customer relations skills and communication efforts of some of the members of staff needs to be improved. The front desk clerk when I checked in was very difficult to understand at some points when she talked and I couldn't understand what she was saying. I had this problem with a few other members of staff. I'm not quite sure whether it was their accents or their enunciation but I rarely have this problem and I'm usually good at hearing. In addition to that, however, some members of the staff just lacked proper communication skills period. On the first day of my stay here, a staff member knocked on the door at about 9AM in the morning (I presumed she was a member of the cleaning staff but then I heard the cleaning staff doing the rooms later in the day so I'm not sure whether she was) and, when I went to opened the door, she just stood there looking at me blankly instead of telling me what her purpose was in being there. It happened again later in my stay as well. I don't think the intention was to be rude but it was quite disconcerting and some members of the staff obviously need better communication skill Room service seemed overpriced, particularly in relation to some of the portions given, and ringing for room service was sometimes a problem (twice the phone was not answered and the third time the people in charge of room service were not available and had to call mem back later). Also most hotels I have stayed in offer a complimentary glass of water with the room service order and this is one of the first hotels I've stayed in around the globe that dÃ­dn't! The charge for wireless internet here is higher than even some of the city hotels and it really shouldn't be that high (most American hotels offer internet access free of charge, I wish more Australian hotels would take the hint!) Despite that, my stay here was pleasant and comfortable and my room was lovely and I would stay here again and recommend it to people in transit or with early morning flights. I hope to be back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, and great for a night stay!”
Reviews.Author: jacarandas
Reviews.Content: I was at Stamford Plaza Sydney recently. This hotel is excellent, if you need a place to sleep for the night before flying out the next day. It provided me with the much needed rest after 24 hours of flying, before taking a domestic flight out the very next morning. I took the shuttle service from the international terminal to the hotel, and from the hotel to the domestic terminal. It costs AUD 6 for a one way journey. The domestic terminal is also a 5 minutes walk away from the hotel, which I would have done if it wasn't raining. The shuttle services were okay, although the bus was rather late from the international terminal to hotel. I had intentions to use the internet at the hotel to check in for my next flight, but found it a little too pricey for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location within short distance of all needs”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: Great location with helpful staff. Value parking at $20 per day unlimited entry. Spa area could do with a hit of bromide and weight room needs some attention and dont rely on the bar being open, but overall you are close to beaches, Newtown and the City with rooms that offer great value and despite planes flying overhead there is absolutley no noise, not like the city where sirens keep you awake most of the night. Traffic movements are hassle free whichever direction you travel. Spoke to other users who shared the same thoughts. Yes I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Christmas Eve”
Reviews.Author: SenseIntoDollars
Reviews.Content: Following a cruise, I stayed at this hotel, just outside the domestic air terminal. It is a classy place with very large rooms and great packages. The Christmas package made the stay even more special. About a half mile away is a shopping street with a bakery, ethnic foods, groceries, etc. The shuttle to the domestic teminal isn't necessary if you're traveling light as it just a hop away from the hotel, but for the international terminal the $6 is OK given that the airport bus between the terminals is $5.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: AussieMumofOne
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay overnight for a stopover on our way out of the country and this was fine. It's a bit of a ripoff that they charge $6 each way for the shuttle, which inconveniently only runs every half hour. The 3-minute taxi ride cost $10 (the minimum from the airport, apparently) and the driver wasn't impressed because he lost his place in the queue. There has to be a better system - maybe a more frequent shuttle? The check-in staff were vague and not very welcoming - maybe the good staff were on summer holidays? The rooms were probably lovely when they were first constructed but they're a bit outdated and in need of a revamp. They're also quite small. The dinner buffet is expensive but expansive. If you're planning more than one course, go for the buffet. The breakfast buffet is also expensive ($35) - we opted for breakfast in the lounge at the airport. For an overnight stay, the hotel is conveniently located next to the airport (you could walk if you didn't have much luggage), but I wouldn't stay there for any other reason.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fourb2
Reviews.Content: Nicely located for the Airport, this large hotel is busy busy busy. Very pleased initially that smoking rooms are still available, although these are the rooms least likely to get a makeover. My room was right beside the elevators, but noise was no problem. The room is comfortable and pretty much what you'd expect, except that the furnishings are chipped and haggard, with ciggie burns. The bed was also a disappointment, with a soft double mattress spread over two single bed bases, it was downright uncomfortable. All staff I encountered were polite, helpful and approachable. Room service menu was quite good, and the food served up delicious. As for the attached AV8 bar, the head barman in there could do with a course in customer service, he was surly and unwelcoming. The food served up in there was at best ordinary. Concierge service was good and requests dealt with in a timely manner. The $6 bus transfer to the airport saves quite a long walk if you have baggage. Rooms don't come cheap, I got a super special price of $140 which to my mind was probably about right given the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good airort Hotel with helpful concierge and secure long term parking for large vehicles”
Reviews.Author: 373RESQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel and used the Stay and Park option whilst we were in LA and New York On our arrival everything was as we had booked and on check in the front desk staff even advised that the standby rate was lower than the Corporate rate and reduced the rate We stayed on the 7th floor and the room was very quiet and well cleaned And equipped The bar staff were excellent and kept me entertained with banter and arguments around Football, the restaurant staff were a little slower and concerned with the impending inspection of the GM however nothing out of the ordinary. We had the seafood buffet and the seafood was fresh but stuff me quite expensive and one of the most expensive seafood buffets I have ever encountered Concierge was excellent with clear details of return days requested so that my vehicle was readily available and upon calling from the shuttle the vehicle was ready on our arrival at the hotel which was very helpful after a 14 hour trip from LAX. The hotel is very handy to the airport and an excellent place to stay the night before an international flight

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a stopover but coffee is not great!”
Reviews.Author: wilsoncm65
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I struggled to find an affordable hotel to stay in Sydney over Xmas when our families ran out of beds. Stamford Plaza Sydney Airport was offering a pretty good rate including brekky so we booked for four nights. The room was big, bed comfy, bathroom quite nice, but it was all a little tired, with the laminate chipped off bedroom furniture, and wallpaper coming away from walls in bathroom etc. It was, however, clean and comfy so no real complaints. Restaurant has a Malaysian/Indonesian kind of theme and dinner was very nice. Breakfast was pretty average for the price with the same foods offered every morning... no variation. Coffee was thoroughly ordinary; breakfast coffee was self-serve from a machine, eek! By the third morning we were ready to pay extra for a latte and a good strong long black, but their real coffee was also ordinary. The room keys are a bit of a problem too so be prepared to have them re-programmed each day to keep them working! Staff are not over-helpful either... service at reception was slow and there was a disagreement at check-in over whether brekky was included in the rate or not. Luckily I had brought a copy of the booking form so they had to honour that. I'd try this hotel again I guess... it would be good for a stopover before or after an international flight, but for any longer than one night I'd be inclined to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: OzzieGuest
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Stamford, chosen for it's location at the airport. Had a good view of Botany Bay and the runways from my room. Thick glass meant almost zero noise. I used the shuttle to/from the airport. There are cheaper hotels nearby but if your budget will allow I'd suggest staying at the Stamford. The Aviator bar was pricey but the meal was good. Lots of airline staff stay here so if you wish to mingle with cabin crew this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Hotabbots
Reviews.Content: When reading the hotel information you would think this was a 5 star hotel - it is not. The reception staff are not very helpful but the conceirge was very good. The hotel says it has a shuttle bus to the airport and you would expect this to be free but it is a pay for trip bus. The rooms are clean but basic, small and starting to show there age. If you are booking via one of the online booking agencies they dont bother looking at special requests, you get what you get. The closest train station is a 10 minutes walk away through some very ordinary industrial estates. I will look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Grand entrance, otherwise average”
Reviews.Author: Tilly_May_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Lobby is beautiful and rooms are nicely furnished, though shabby. Service at check-in was slow, and restaurant service was painfully slow, meaning that we missed dessert because the kitchen had closed. Taxi to the airport was easy and cost under $10, a cheaper and more convenient option than the shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “excellent overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: tboy2000
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, modern and clean. The front desk service was efficient and friendly. We stayed here after an early morning international arrival. Though we waited a while for our room to be ready we were in our room by 10:30 AM. It's close to the airport and not far from Sydney. There's a shuttle from the airport to the hotel, it was a little confusing to find the right van and you pay for the service when you check out of the hotel. It was a 20 minute taxi ride into Sydney costing about $30. There is also a train a few blocks away. We spent the day in Sydney and returned to the hotel that night. One nice bonus was that the hotel is not in an isolated area. It's just a 2 block walk to the shopping street in the town of Mascot and we walked there for breakfast in the morning before leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient access to the airport, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: YYZtotheworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Stamford to make catching an early flight the next day a little easier. Location is ideal near the airport, with the domestic terminal a 5 minute walk away (I wouldnt recommend walking but the point is that it's very close!) The hotel advertises extra insulated windows to reduce noise from the airport. I'm very sensitive to noise and can vouch for the fact there was little outside noise to be heard. Room was larger than expected and bed very comfortable. Exercise area was also a pleasant surprise with free weights (unusual at hotels) along with pool access. The "shuttle service" is not very well explained. Ultimately, paying $6 each way to and from the airport is not a lot of money (particularly given how expensive taxis are in Sydney) but an irritant to have to pay this at a hotel that is at the price point it is (why not offer a voucher for free shuttle?). Overall, had a restful stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Better than other airport hotel options”
Reviews.Author: theheadland
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Airport Mercure and Holiday Inn and the Stamford Plaza is nicer, but overall it's a pretty average experience. The room type we booked (king) wasnt available so we had to stay in twin room. There goes the romance. The room was very clean and comfortable, but scruffy - chipped furniture & scrape marks on the wall. The decor was also very dated - faux french provincial in beige on beige. We stayed on Christmas eve and had a "summer saver" rate that included breakfast. It was an average breakfast - very glad we didnt pay full price for it.

Reviews.Title: “very bad experience!”
Reviews.Author: MDeMatt
Reviews.Content: careful what you agree on for that hotel. The room is fine, but the advertised cheap price is almost never available, you will pay for the superior room price, to which just about everything including the air you breathe will be added. Incredibly expensive internet, extra charge ($35 ) for someone to sit in the cafe and watch you have a cup of coffee at the buffet breakfast bar!! The car valet told me it would cost me only $5 surcharge to have my car parked, it actually costs $25. There is no fresh fruit on the floor, and there are no complimentary slippers. I called about the extra bkfst charge (never consumed), I am still waiting for the 'manger will call back' . Big surcharge for paying by credit card of course too. Never again for me.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent standards; in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: julie1forme
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and daughter spent one night at this hotel as a stopover on our way home from travel in the US. Some aspects were great; others very disappointing. Reception staff efficient. Room smelled of paint, but otherwise good. Had to wait in the bar area on arrival for a table for three at about 8.30pm on a Saturday night, as did the previous couple before us. Not a long wait admittedly, just five minutes, but we were tired from a long flight and hungry and it did seem odd when there were lots of vacant tables. I guess they were seating patrons in the front part of the restaurant. Then when we were seated the chairs were scratched and the green fabric on the handles and seat were stained...didn't give me confidence in the food hygiene standards. Food was OK; probably had been better earlier in the evening; lots of items no longer left. Confused about how the noodle bar worked. We had explained that we had the Meal deal but were taken to our seat and not told anything until about ten minutes later (that our set menu had been ordered); by this time we'd already started in on the buffet. Staff member very obliging saying not to worry. Serving area of the restaurant needs a makeover: dated. We asked for late checkout and this was happily given: terrific. We slept well: great crisp sheets, appealling bathroom, nice furnishings, curtains. Charge for internet excessive: approx 55c/min to a max of $29 in a 24 hr period. Charge for shuttle bus for three was $36/return. Buffet breakfast was outstanding in choice and food quality and replenishing food. We ate early about 7am Sunday morning. Went to relax in pool and spa area but disappointed with both: no umbrellas or other shade in pool area; pool was cold not heated, pool and surroundings tired and in need of upgrade. Spa in a separate area and just awful: smelled like mould, cold water, got out after 30 secs. Check out efficient. Staff helpful, pleasant. Wouldn't stay here again although , in fairness, given the meal deal the rate was good value. We would have preferred to pay a little more in taxi fares vs. shuttles and go to a hotel of our choice in Sydney with a nice pool and spa which is how we choose to refresh after a long flight when we are breaking our journey. This is more important to us than food. The photos of the dining area in the Stamford booklet in our room focused on the dining area near the bar where the chairs were not worn or stained and of a different fabric. Still had to think that these photos were when it was new, rather than recent photos.

Reviews.Title: “Stamford Plaza Review”
Reviews.Author: Gateway1_10
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here recently after spending a month visiting Australia. The Front Desk staff were very good and took care of all our requests. The room was fine and met our expectations for a location convenient to the Sydney Airport. However, the Grove Restaurant did not match up. We had dinner and breakfast there and compared to recent meals in Port Douglas, the Grove came in a distant second. The dinner preparation was reasonable but the service was extremely slow even though the restaurant was not busy. We ordered dessert and both orders were botched up. Considering the prices they charge, I found this very upsetting. The next morning, we had the breakfast buffet and again found the cost of the meal ($35 for a full Australian breakfast) to be overpriced. I would recommend this hotel based on its location to the airport but suggest eating elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Unenthusiastic”
Reviews.Author: Sigfried
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel through Orbitz for a stopover. Sounds better on paper than it is. The positives are that it is convenient to the airport, the rooms are large and quiet and the price was reasonable. The negatives are many. Hot water at variable temperature in shower, internet access at 0.55 a minute, $6 per person airport shuttle, worn linens and towels, dirty carpet and an uninspired breakfast buffet, priced at $35 per person. We had stayed in Melbourne and Manly for weeks and judge that even in a local context, this hotel is, overall, a very poor value. The airport cafe in the attached office building is, by contrast, much better in all respects. There are other hotels in the area that would likely be superior.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DameDuFerAustralie
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times purely due to the hotel's convenient proximity to the airport. There was parking available under the hotel which we used this time, it cost $20/24hrs but would have been a whole lot easier to pay for valet parking as the parking area is very confined, valet parking would have cost $25/24hrs - but the porter didn't mention they had valet parking when we pulled in front of the hotel to ask where the parking was....... We had an OK room service dinner - I ordered the Asian dumpling soup which was very average, and my partner ordered a chicken pizza which was quite nice. We avoided breakfast the next morning as thought the price tag for a Continental breakfast was way too steep at almost $30 a pop. Rooms are large, comfortable and quiet considering you're right next door to a busy airport, TV worked, Internet worked, nice bathroom however ridiculously shallow bath so can't actually relax into it. It took us almost 30mins wait to check-out at around 10am on the SUnday morning, so beware if you're catching a flight, allow plenty of time to check-out as they only had 2 desk staff working. Overall was pretty good value for money, but I wouldn't bother eating here unless I really had to.

Reviews.Title: “As expected from Stamford”
Reviews.Author: Waddles54
Reviews.Content: We checked in here after a flight from the UK. The checkin was efficient and quick, the rooms spacious, clean and welcoming. This was what we expected from the Stamford, having stayed at their other hotels in Australia. The bed was very comfortable. Our early departure the next morning was organised by the desk with a minimum of fuss. Made the end of the holiday much easier. An excellent hotel close the airport.

Reviews.Title: “It did the job”
Reviews.Author: Pluffy81
Reviews.Content: After arriving in on a long flight from Hawaii the Stamford was a great location. I chose the Stamford as I had previously stayed at the property. The check in staff seemed bothered by our arrival but did the job and got us into our room with out too much fuss. We needed extra towells which again seemed to be a bother but we got them. When we rang for room service we were hung up on. I don't know if this was an accident but we didn't get a call back. I would imagine that they would have been able to see what room we were calling from?? Once ordered the food arrived with in the time frame told and was quite nice. Movie selection to order is great. Breakfast buffet was really bad. The food was cold, the eggs looked like they were left overs from the day before and the staff that were on that morning were clearly not interested. We were there at 7am so it's not as if they were trying to pack up to move on to a lunch menu. I'm glad that breakfast was included in the room rate as I would not have paid for it. In saying all this I would stay there again if only for the location

Reviews.Title: “My family had a great weekend stay at the Stamford Plaze Sydney Airport”
Reviews.Author: Fiona S
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for two nights and had a great time - the room was big enough for us all (two adults and two kids). We went in the spa, sauna and pool and ate at the restaurant. The service was excellent from all staff and they were quick to respond to any of our requests to a high standard. Our kids also loved watching the planes go over. Of note is that you cannot hear the planes in the room due to double glazed windows. Extremely easy to get too - just follow domestic airport signs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kdawson1985
Reviews.Content: Standard comfortable accommodation - just what you need for overnight accommodation at the airport. Good price ($155pn) we walked from Virgin domestic terminal to the hotel and booked ourselves on the shuttle from the hotel - international airport. I cant remember what the shuttle per person fee was but it was definitely needed although would be nice to have this as a complimentary service.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gavin W
Reviews.Content: Stayed her overnight in September after a late flight in - a little outdated, could do with a refurb. Staff were freindly at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “NEEDS UPDATING”
Reviews.Author: RockyBubbles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, rooms are very average. The main enticement was a free bottle of wine and breakfast included, which was far better than the other hotels in the area had to offer. The hotel needs a refurbishment, other than that it was comfortable enough for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StillPhone
Reviews.Content: Yes it's an airport hotel but it has big clean tidy rooms and it just feels very comfortable. Homely almost, which is weird... The service is great. The views of the airport are great, without the aircraft noise. Where else can you stay and watch a 787 approach over your bed in silence. The bar is average, although AV8 (tacky) is cool, Â the omelets are unreliable and the credit card fee plus internet suck but I still really like staying here... Some hotels have that ability to feel like a home when obviously they are not and this is one of the good ones. Puts London and Auckland to shame to name two... That said, drop the credit card fee because that's just stupid and annoys everyone plus why not provide free Wi-Fi in the bars? It's free most places now. Eat/drink at the Newnarket Hotel which is nearby and has way better food.

Reviews.Title: “Airport hotel: good location at a cost”
Reviews.Author: Matelot2000
Reviews.Content: The Stamford is easy walking distance from the Domestic Terminal (less than 10 minutes) which is fine for average fitness people and/or those who have limited luggage. Taxi drivers will not thank you for their queuing for a fare for an hour to get a $5 fare to the Stamford! Check-in was at 2245 and was swift although by this time there was not much in catering options left available. The room was a typical hotel room - sizes are worked out scientifically so they are generally about 33-35m2 including the bathroom. Minibar prices were on the expensive side and telephone calls from their 'phone were extravagantly dear - a 10 minute call to the UK can cost you half the price of a room. However, the Stamford does provide a clear statement of charges so you are forewarned, which is more than some other hotels do. Breakfast seems to be averaging at close to $40 a head these days at many business hotels. If you are an airline lounge member, save your company the cost and get a free breakfast at the lounge or buy it in the food hall. Check-out had a queue of 20 people at two desks at 0700 and it was taking a very long-time to get a client checked-out - perhaps the clients were stunned over the other charges. If the company is paying, fine, otherwise use a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: natski81
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located right next to Sydney domestic terminal.We had one night stopover before our connection after a long international flight. Front desk staff were very nice and super polite. Our room was very clean and had two double beds.It is a little dated but it was a stopover so i am not really fussed. The room was amazingly quiet. we faced the airport with a train line right outside our window and we couldn't hear a thing at all. Even in the morning i was amazed to pull back the blackout curtains and see it was morning and traffic everywhere and we couldn't hear a thing. Very soundproof. Breakfast buffett was included and was good-all the usual. A shuttle took us to the airport in the morning for $6 a person. We were very impressed with the service that evening from the nearby AV8 bar. we had ducked in there to get a meal at around 8:30 pm and ordered two Medium steaks. unfortunately the kitchen must have been in a hurry to get home because they came out rare-borderline blue. I usually have no issue with even eating medium rare but this was beyond that. Add to the fact we were exhausted and surrounded by a bunch of loud drunks we decided to get a refund for the meal and head up to our room. The server was amazing and so apologetic. If we weren't so tired we would have been happy for him to cook then a bit more but we had to lie down. So he not only refunded us but ensured the room service we ordered, we were given a discount for their inconvenience. Not something they needed to do but its the little things like that, that can make a place shine. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A dreary airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: talktwojohn
Reviews.Content: It's hard not to come across as cynical based on this review. The Stamford Plaza Sydney Airport is a typically grim airport hotel. Perhaps it had a genuine five star feel during the Sydney Olympics in 2000, but now it's a transit hotel. ROOMS This is a five star hotel; the rooms feel like any airport hotel. For context, the Brisbane Stamford Plaza feels much better. FACILITIES The restaurant used for breakfast is grubby. The seat coverings are caked in grease and need instant replacement of upholstery. Breakfast was poorly managed by the kitchen with little attention to detail or the guests. Porridge was watery and inedible. Service quality was poor. Dining area was dark and dingy. Coffee was either black or black. Not a coffee machine of barista quality in sight. The dining area was opressively dark, I couldn't wait to leave. WOULD I RETURN? I would only return to this hotel due to the location and convenience for getting to Sydney airport. Cost versus quality is prohibitive. Mr Ong and Mr Foo could do with giving this hotel some botox of the good hotel variety,

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy.”
Reviews.Author: beedoo747
Reviews.Content: Let me say first off that I have stayed at this hotel on many occasions, sometimes for over a week at a time. We are plane geeks and this hotel used to have the best airport view combined with excellent customer service and reasonable pricing. A friend of mine was flying in from the USA a few hours ahead of the time we could be in Sydney due to work and living on the South Coast. For several reasons, I wanted the payment for the room and any hold on a credit/debit card to be placed on *my* account. I emailed the hotel in advance to check the procedure for this and was told I needed to fill in a form and scan both sides of my credit card and send it back to them, which I did. I was told notes would be placed on the system. When my friend arrived at the hotel, nobody there knew anything about the form I had filled in, and they demanded to swipe my friends credit card. They placed a $650 hold on the account! $450 for the accommodation (which I was more than happy to pay) and $200 for incidentals (highly excessive, in my opinion). Due to his credit card being from the US, there were also going to be a bunch of fees and charges and currency differences, so in total the hold placed on his account was nearly $700. This was exactly what I wanted to avoid, and what I went to so much trouble to sort out in advance. Especially after reading reviews here re the holds they put on accounts. When I arrived at the hotel and discussed it with the duty manager, a verbal apology was all that I was offered. That really didn't do a lot for me. Even worse, I had to explain what had happened several times because it did not seem like the person was listening to me or understanding what I was trying to say, especially about the extra fees and charges. They were unable to reverse the hold on my friends account as it was a weekend (I had also foreseen that being a problem, which again was why I tried to fix it in advance) and told my friend that in order to have it reversed on Monday they would need a fax number for his bank and all his bank details. Unfortunately Monday here is still Sunday in the US, so faxing the bank would do no good whatsoever. It also seemed like reservations and the hotel itself do not communicate as the room was set up for one person and three of us were staying in it. The booking confirmation I have clearly states 3 people. Sadly, this hotel is looking extremely tired. There was paint peeling from the cornices, there were chips of paint and chips of marble missing in the bathroom. My favourite plane spotting chair was not present in the room at all. There was some unknown white mystery substance dripped all over the bedhead and wall. I won't say what I suspected it might be, but it was bad enough and made me uncomfortable enough that I cleaned it off myself. Lucky for us we were only using the room as a base for somewhere to sleep and plane watch in between day trips. But we could have made a base for ourselves across the road at Formule 1 and as long as we brought our own pillows and a floor mat for the bathroom (see my review of that hotel for an explanation of that!) we would have saved ourselves a bunch of money. On top of all that they wanted to charge us $20 a night for carparking. Carparking used to be included at the regular room rate, which was what we were paying. On check out I paid for the room with my credit card, as planned. The total was $456 ($6 for the one way shuttle bus my friend took from the airport). When I complained once again to the completely different duty manager re the hold placed on the account and my friend was giving him the bank details, I requested that the car parking not be charged to us. Note, it was not *offered* to me, I had to ask. The duty manager did agree to not charge us for the carparking. Given the inconvenience for my friend who was unable to access a large amount of his funds for several days (two days later the funds still are being held as I write this), I would have thought they would offer to remove the $6 shuttle bus fee as well, but they did not. I have to say I am truly disappointed that a hotel which has always been so reliable customer service wise and facility wise has allowed themselves to go downhill at such a fast rate of knots. It was always my first go to hotel when I needed to stay near the airport but now I will have to look elsewhere. The view is still first class. That is something the hotel has no control over whatsoever, though! :) And the things they can control they are epically failing at.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly Good”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Paul_AU
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews comparing the Holiday Inn Sydney Airport, where I stayed last time for a short trip, and the Stamford, my expectations were not as high. I chose this hotel on price for the night ($175 compared to $210 for the Holiday Inn). My business was in the vicinity of the airport and I was flying in and out within 24 hours. Impressions: Lobby: comfortable and welcoming. Reception Staff: Courteous, efficient. Restaurant Menu: Did not eat here, but the prices seemed reasonable and the setting quiet, with a Singaporean menu which looked good. Room: Large - quite large - and well appointed. Soundproofing: Excellent! Drapes: Blockout - slept in until nearly 0900 the room was so dark! Good wardrobe storage, good suitcase storage, excellent firm King Size bed with pillow selection. Air Conditioning: efficient and quiet. Pool - big enough to actually swim some laps. Bathroom - very good, and liked the sensor light to avoid middle of the night stumbles. Express Check out was used and this saved me some time as a large group was checking in/out. There is a 7-11 type store next door, and also a cafe off premises next door. Early check in (11am) and late check out (12pm) was organised at no extra charge. Overall: great value for money at the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.....”
Reviews.Author: Novajim2010
Reviews.Content: Good service (although arriving just after a full bus was not the best) and a nice room are the keys to an airport hotel. Had a one bedroom suite that was perfect for our needs, and spent tow nights there to accomidate some airport business. Restaurant was good, but a but pricey even for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: c0untryc0uple
Reviews.Content: We chose the Stamford Plaza Sydney Airport as it offered a stay- park-fly package with transfers to the airport as we had an early morning flight. The room was clean and comfortable. It was also very quiet. The room was large, as was the bathroom. The only thing in the bathroom that could have been improved was a mark along the wall above the bath. The Coates sign outside was handy as the time was displayed throughout the night and as I was scared of sleeping in I was assured each time I woke. To eliminate this I could have closed the curtains but I did not need to. Breakfast was also included in our package. We did have a problem when we attempted to use the computer in the room provided downstairs; we were unable to connect easily and then anot able to print, the conscierge eventually did what we needed but we were still charged on our bill. (We did not pay as it was @ $25 very overpriced! for nothing). We had the seafood buffet in the restaurant downstairs and it was very nice but had been hard to find out when it was available. There was no mention of it in room information. We were happy with our stay and package. We were albe to pick up the car upon our return. One thing I would mention that might cause an upset with someone's holiday is the transfers. We had our tickets for our return as we had checked in and paid before our holiday but the bus driver was very abrupt (even rude). Another guest who we had met at the airport and had prepaid her accomodation and transfers online was spoken to very rudely by the bus driver who demanded her ticket and again by the doorman who was also very abrupt with her and to insisted (to the point of hostility) that she must have a ticket to have used the bus. She was tired after a long trip and thought that she had made all necessary payments. Witnessing the way she was treated was very upsetting and I am sure it spoilt her stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great views of airport”
Reviews.Author: nikaus21
Reviews.Content: 1st time staying at this hotel, we booked because we had an early morning flight next day. Room was on 9th floor, we had fantastic view of airport, watching planes land & take-off. Windows were double glazed and the bed was super comfy, so we got a great nights' sleep.Would definitely stay here again.Room was spacious with king size bad, very tastefully furnished.

Reviews.Title: “above average”
Reviews.Author: puntrd
Reviews.Content: We decided to attend the NRL grand final, but instead of paying a bomb for a city hotel on the Saturday and Sunday nights (long weekend in Sydney) we decided to fly in from Melbourne on the Saturday night, stay near the airport, travel in Olympic Park precinct on the Sunday and then back to the airport hotel on Sunday for a morning flight back on the Monday. Couldn't have worked out any better. We didn't need to rip-off shuttle ($6 each way) as we only had hand luggage and the hotel was only a 7-minute walk from the terminal. Check in was smooth and friendly. The room was nice. I had a great view of the airport runways with aircraft taking off and landing, but could hear anything thanks to the soundproof windows.Room service was promt and not too badly overpriced for a light dinner of burger of chips ($19) but woefull overpriced for breakfast ($34). The restaurant and bar were good places to relax. Bed was comfy and large and the flat screen TV had plenty of channels. Instead of walking back to the terminal to catch the train into the city (and paying $16.40), walked to Mascot station (10 minutes) and it only cost $3.20 - the airport surcharges are a ripoff. Bear this in mind if you need to go Central Station. I found all the staff to be pleasant and professional and I would definitely consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was great and comfortable but $100 credit card notification not funny”
Reviews.Author: trishymelbourne
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice after a long day. I booked this room on wotif-com.au and pre-paid for the room. I also stayed at 3 other hotels in Sydney. This is where my problem at the Stamford Plaza Sydney airport starts on check-in. Each time I stayed in a hotel throughout the week I handed over my credit card for security. Each hotel swiped my card with a notification just in case. I was advised by the Stamford Plaza that they don't just swipe it they actually charge you a hold of $100. The problem was that I spent probably all up $2500 dollars in Sydney (not on my card). I left a few hundred dollars on my card for hotel notifications. My bad luck if 3 hotels had already put holds on my card before I checked into the Stamford Plaza. My card wouldn't work. They were not going to let me check-in despite me pre-paying for my room.
