They state it is hotel policy. At no time was I advised of this bond when booking before hand. If I was I would have taken $100 cash to the hotel before hand. My fault for spending up big in Sydney that day. The doorman would have preferred that I give him my last $100 cash for dinner etc. Luckily for me my daughter used her card. My point though, what if I didn't have the $100 for the bond (I wasn't made aware of this before checking in) Would the Stamford Plaza Sydney Airport throw us out into the street late at night? I got the feeling they were going to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkably good for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: BonzoD
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful front desk, large comfortable room, restaurant with decent food (including buffet breakfast) and two relaxed bars (one cocktail, the other sports) make this hotel ideal for an overnight stay or short stopovers. Try the Nasi Padang if you're dining in. Both domestic and international airports are within a 5 - 10 minute coach ride ($6).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel - but watch out for charges”
Reviews.Author: SWGH123
Reviews.Content: Just stayed two nights at this Hotel on business. The rooms are very comfortable, clean and quiet - so no difficulties getting sleep here - even though it is close to a busy airport. The room had a reasonably stocked minibar and a good sized bathroom with a shower over the bathtub. There are two restaurants available for meals. On the first night, we opted for the pub restaurant and had a really good, hearty meal. Prices were reasonable - although being a pub, it was a wee bit noisy. Breakfast was not included in the hotel price and cost an extra $20 each day. Broadband and wireless internet is available, but be warned it is very expensive (55c per minute). The room also had a telephone pricing list in the room for calls abroad. Again be warned this did not appear to apply to the one call I made - so I ended up paying alot more than expected. When checking out I was also advised that all payments made by credit cards attract an additional % fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Chantal A
Reviews.Content: Fabulous value for money and right outside the Sydney Domestic Airport. Rooms were very large and bathroom was quite roomy too! What we were most surprised with was that we did not hear one single plane passing. It was strange we could see them approaching through the window and even though we strained to hear them - we just didn't. We ordered room service on the first night and the pizza, satays and wedges were great! The room was great value and we were able to walk to the train station in about 5-10 mins and were in the city within 15 mins - overall it was a great place to stay. Oh the only downfall we found was that there was no kids channel on the television!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: mossvale
Reviews.Content: easy drive to get to a bit crazy when your in peak hour traffic but is at the the airport staff were good from check in the room was a good size clean we ate at the resturant food was very nice we had a great deal standard room,breakfast,parking,high noon tea for $185.00 which was a great deal we had a 18th at pagewood so a 10 min taxi drive

Reviews.Title: “Nice potato wedges. Yummy creamy mushroom. Full stop.”
Reviews.Author: DarumaDaruma
Reviews.Content: My first impression about this hotel was not good and I think I checked-out from Stamford Plaza with the same impression: - My partner and I arrived using a taxi and we had 2 bags and 1 big box. We looked left and right, but we couldn't find a single porter or concierge staff. (There was a porter at the lobby but he was busy talking on mobile phone). We could see through the glass door that some staff at the check-in counter looking at us struggling with our luggage, but they did nothing. - We decided to stay at the hotel for the whole day and ordered something to eat (in-room dining). We followed the instruction given at the Directory (ie. Dial 7 for Room Service), but our call was unanswered; we tried to press the button which shows symbols of people carrying trays but again our call was automatically diverted to a message box. (We're hungry!!!) Then we decided to call operator to order our food. If the operator didn't pick up the phone, we might've called Pizza Hut... - It seems more training needs to be given to those who are working in the cleaning area. When we checked in (around 9-ish am) we saw one cleaning trolley next to our room. We didn't understand how he/she cleaned the room/ made-up the room, but surely we heard a lot of banging on the wall. - Last but not least, when we settled our final bill, we were charged for shuttle-bus fee on our arrival date (we arrived with taxi). Luckily we always went through every single item on our bill. - This one is very trivia.... it's the decoration in the room. Not sure why there's a huge clay pot on the top of the TV cabinet. Arts? Not sure.... It's an eyesore. + The only good point was that its close location to the domestic airport and there's shuttle bus to/from airport for just $6 per person. + And thank God our in-room dining order came up pretty nice. I do recommend potato wedges with sour cream. Reasonable price and tasty too (no service tax and government tax. What you see is what you pay). +/- Our package includes breakfast for two, so we maximised this opportunity to sample some food at the ground floor. The selection was quite alright; creamy mushroom was yummy, hashbrown was crispy, but there were some little flying insects around cold-food area. All in all, for the price that we paid, it's an ok experience. If our favourite hotel at Circular Quay was not fully booked, we wouldn't choose this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Has everything you require”
Reviews.Author: NeilPerthWA
Reviews.Content: Service was good and room also good. I believe the best Hotel near the airport. Also free shuttle bus service provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Food and excellent view”
Reviews.Author: jayjas
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Stamford Plaza Sydney Airport. The seafood buffet at their restuarant was supberb. Avove all, being an aviation enthusiast, i really enjoyed the view from my room, overlooking the runway. the staffs at the counter were very friendly all in all we receive a five star service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Funtime22
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the hotel, the staff looked after us, nothing was a problem. The rooms are clean and very close to the airport

Reviews.Title: “We will be looking for somewhere else to eat”
Reviews.Author: LovedaleHunterValley
Reviews.Content: The hotel reception on arrival was OK on the Friday night, excellent during the day on our return to pick up the car. The restaurant is way overpriced for what we got, 2 prawns & 2 fishcakes for $21. This took almost an hour to get. The room however was clean & comfortable. No where near the quality of Sir Stamford at Circular Quay. As a gateway to Sydney it is a shame that the restaurant is so ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Melissa Y
Reviews.Content: We held an event this past June in the Centennial Room. We were so impressed with the attention to detail. Everything flowed very well from the communication prior to the event, parking, shuttle buses from the airport, room set up to the catering of the event. This is the best customer service I have experienced in Sydney since moving here 3 years ago. Well done and we will be holding future events at the Stamford Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: cebazat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stamford the night before an early flight to the UK. The shuttle bus was convenient, room was clean and fairly large. However we ate in the dark and gloomy restaurant for dinner the night we arrived and were unimpressed with the food in the a la carte menu. There was also a seafood buffet which didn't appeal. As we were catching the early flight, we didn't have breakfast so unable to comment. Overall, the hotel is convenient and clean but don't expect too much in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not special. Avoid 12th floor.”
Reviews.Author: gafra
Reviews.Content: My stay here was for one night only before an early morning departure next day from Sydney airport. Reception was efficient, if a little cold. Room was clean, spacious and welcoming, however I think the top floor (level 12 where I stayed) is directly below the elevator cable motor. A constant stop-start motor sound did not make getting to sleep very easy. Can't vouch for the rest of the facilities as I didn't use them. AV8r bar is tired and needs an update.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL FOR BUSINESS”
Reviews.Author: onghurt
Reviews.Content: We stay Stamford Plaza for 3 night, the facilities are great for the conference. The room was really comfortable bed and good city views. There was everything that you good need that other hotel you need.The bath room was very nice and modern it had a lovely shower. We would recommend this hotel to everyone who wants love this hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Wifi charges”
Reviews.Author: margaretinnz
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights, pre paid, they had lost my booking kept me waiting for 45 mins ie after I had just had 30+ hours in planes. Made one call to a mobile $16, total bill $86 for one wine the rest wifi charges, exhorbitant, in the back streets if Istanbul in a very small cafe I could get free wifi for a cup of coffee yet paying Near $200A per night I was charged this ridiculous amount. When I first moved in the telephone was not connected, I spent an hour trying to get service, the whole staff Excluding the consierge were slow to comprehend their fault in not connecting the phone, ther was not one apology

Reviews.Title: “Ok for an overnight stop at the airport”
Reviews.Author: tallscottishperson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here enroute from the UK back to Hobart and got a good deal on Wotif.com secret hotel deal. Everything was OK, but just that. I get really put off by hotels charging every extra cent they can for extras, just because the can. I know a lot of hotels do this for internet, shuttles, rooms service etc but it is why I am not giving this hotel a more positve review. The staff were all good and helpful but to be asked to pay the extortionate prices for breakfast is ridiculous. I asked if there was an a la carte option if you just wanted tea nad toast and was told no, $20 or nothing! Meals from room service were ridiculously expensive. I'd probably stay again for the convenience but not for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: council_worker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 2 seperate occasions in August either side of a trip to the Gold Coast. No real problems with anything. Wake up call was on time, breakfast was excellent, concierge helpful, quick check in and check out. Rooms are starting to get dated but this is only rated as a 4 star place. You stay at a hotel to sleep, not to admire the furnishings and the sleep quality was excellent. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for an airport stay, but getting pricey”
Reviews.Author: Aust1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here quite a few times, the night before a flight out. Always been reasonable, for a good standard of hotel. Now starts at $200. Still very nice rooms and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - great service - good location if flying out!”
Reviews.Author: HaydnAustralia
Reviews.Content: This has been a really good hotel. The room was very clean and neat. Everything worked. Nice sized flat screen TV. The little bar / restuarant downstairs had a really nice bar menu. There are specials most weeknights that are around $10 - $14. Tonight was $14 pizza's. I elected to go bangers and mash for $18. Very nice indeed. The rooms is really quiet (I was on the 10th floor)....no aircraft noise and I was in the room from about 7.00 pm on a weeknight. The staff are very friendly. Shuttle to the domestic or international terminal is $6.00 and you need to book. Pity its not free but then - is anything nowdays??? Shuttle goes at very regular intervals. I walked here from the domestic terminal and it only took me about 10 mins to make the distance - easy footpath all the way - just exit the domestic terminal and turn left - keep walking and looking to the left...you'll see the hotel. You can't miss it. If you are looking for an airport hotel this is a really good one by my reckoning.

Reviews.Title: “Best of a bad bunch of hotels”
Reviews.Author: bnecpl
Reviews.Content: The fact that this hotel is the better of all those at Sydney Airport is a really bad reflection on the hotels at Australia's largest airport. Don't get me wrong - it's location right across the road from the domestic terminal is good, views from the rooms arte nice and the lobby is well appointed. Rooms however - well they haven't been renovated in a good 15 years - the beds and pillows are lumpy, the air conditioning in my room this week banged all night - basically the rooms need some updating and attention. AV8 bar is ok, restaurant is ok, there is also a cafe & convenience store in the drive way of the hotel. Staff are friendly enough - check-in and out can be a bit of a mission if you arrive at the same time as a large air crew. I will say that when compared to other airport hotels the staff here do go more out of their way to make the stay pleasant. With a renovation this hotel would be fantastic - in the meantime it's above average and the best if you're needing to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a night between flights”
Reviews.Author: bobborn
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for when your domestic flights don't sync up with your international flights, which happens to me often. It's easy to get to: take the Airport Shuttle bus from Bay32 at the Int'l terminal. It takes 10 minutes. and costs $6 which they conveniently charge to your room. My room was spacious and comfortable; no complaints. Be aware that an internet connection is expensive, but that is common in Sydney. Unlike most hotel restaurants, theirs is a standout. If you want an all-you-can-eat buffet they have an awesome seafood and meat buffet dinner for AUD$59. The meat is presented raw, and they cook it to your order with vegetables and anything else you throw on your plate, like some stir-fry restaurants. The crab claws and prawns are awesome. If you prefer a la carte, they have a submenu called Taste of Singapore with delicious dishes like Wonton Soup with prawns and chicken dumplings, asian greens, and egg noodles for AUD$19. It was one of the best I've ever had and was a big enough serving to be my main dish. I had a side of Roti for $3 that was flaky almost like filo dough that was unique and yummy. I never expected to find such culinary pleasure at an airport hotel, but this is the real deal. If you need to catch a morning flight somewhere, I heartily recommend this hotel, Don't forget to break bread here too.

Reviews.Title: “Not really 5 star (self rated)”
Reviews.Author: ValueLover
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for its proximity to the airport as we had an early morning flight. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and really quiet given the proximity to the airport. TV channels were limited. The furniture in the room was tired and chipped which surprised me given it is a self rated 5 star hotel. If the Sheraton on the Park is 5 star then this is only 4 star. Staff were courteous and friendly. The buffet breakfast was just OK. I would stay here again if needing to get to the airport early and the price of $230 included a three share room, parking, high tea and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Quality did not match the price”
Reviews.Author: nonistocker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient for Sydney airport (nearer to the domestic terminal than the international). However, for the price/room charged, we expected more. The rooms are quite dated, but adequate for one night. However, the dining facilities have much to be desired! The fabric chairs were stained and grubby. The food was really not up to standard of a 4* hotel (the vegetable lasagne had veggies that were so overcooked or re-heated that they appeared to be grey)- certainly not very fresh! I think they have

Reviews.Title: “as far as airport hotels go it was at the low end of average”
Reviews.Author: sussiedoozie
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here - as most people do when they are staying at an airport hotel. It was ok, nothing outstanding, nothing terrible,just ok, the shuttle worked well. What has prompted me to revivew this hotel is the price of airport hotels in sydney compared to anywhere else in the world where I have stayed at one They all seem to be extremely expensive for what they are. This one was at the very low end of average compared to others I have stayed at in other cities and expensive compared to other cities. I expect more for money.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport but ...”
Reviews.Author: ARAC
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here as we had an early flight from the airport. It was fairly difficult to find and nigh on impossible to find a way into the right part of the car park, but that wasn't helped by the fact that we were caught in a torrential downpour. The staff weren't very friendly and tried to charge us (a higher rate) for the room even though I had the email confirming that we'd already paid in full. I wouldn't recommend it and if I was in the same position again I'd stay in the city and use the train link to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: ekile
Reviews.Content: We were on a trip delay and were put up in this hotel by our airline. From the beginning we had problems with the staff: The woman who checked us in was rude and unfriendly (she didn't even greet us with a 'hello'), and the concierge was condescending when I asked for maps of the area (maybe he didn't like it that I took a map from the counter, but he didn't greet me either, so I thought if I wanted service I would have to help myself). The airline promised us complimentary breakfast, but when we went down to the restaurant in the morning, the host at the restaurant said we needed a voucher. We had not received one when we checked in and when we asked at the front desk about it, the same woman who was there the day before said we didn't need one! The lack of communication between staff members was frustrating. Also, when the line to be seated at the restaurant got a little long, one of the busboys came over to help out--but the restaurant host reprimanded him sharply and sent him away. I did not like to see an employee treated that way. We had just as indifferent a reception when we checked out the next day. Even though we weren't charged for the room, the extra charges were outrageous: It cost us $162 for a 20-minute phone call to our travel agent in the US! Be very aware of hidden costs like that before you use any services. The only reason I'm giving this hotel more than one star is because the "service" people (non-reception, such as the housekeepers and busboys) were very friendly. Their "superiors" at the reception desk could learn something from them about customer service! Also, the facilities were nice: The room was clean and comfortable, and the gym was excellent. Keep in mind that this is very much an airport hotel. If you do not have your own transportation and you would like to go into the city, you will either have to pay for a taxi, or walk a mile to the subway station. If you plan on just staying in your room the whole time and not interacting with any employees, you might do just fine here.

Reviews.Title: “Good and clean”
Reviews.Author: Businessaway
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport. Quiet. Convenient Shuttle bus to and from.

Reviews.Title: “An enforced stay made very pleasant, nice room, gym and good food”
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a couple due to cancellation of a Virgin flight due to bad weather. Virgin put us up here, paid for transfers and a dinner allowance, very generous of them considering it wasn't their fault. We found the staff to be friendly and efficient from check in through to check out, room 306 was very comfortable. great bed and bedding and a disabled friendly bathroom so it was quite spacious, even if my wife's feet didn't reach the floor from the toilet! We both used the gym facilities which had good equipment and was very popular while we were there. We didn't use the pool as it was outside. Everything was clean and everything worked so that's always a good start. Rather than try to get into the restaurant on a busy night (State of Origin + flight disruptions) we ate from the room service menu and were very impressed. Often room service doesn't do justice to good food but we ordered Asian style food and it was really good and plentiful as well. Couldn't fault it and service was fast. So we had a full tummy and a good sleep before catching our early (then delayed!) flight. I can't comment on value as we didn't pay the bill but we couldn't find fault with anything so can only recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best airport hotel in Australia”
Reviews.Author: rajiv91
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Christmas day last year, and really enjoyed our stay here. It is right next to the domestic airport, and we opted for a high floor room on 9th floor facing the airport. The view was spectacular, offering unrivalled and unobstructed views of Botany Bay and the runways. You can sit and watch all landings and take offs whole day long, until the airport curfew kicks off at 11pm. We ordered some Malaysian food from room service, it was very delicious and relatively inexpensive. Some airlines, including Malaysian airlines, put up their flight crew at this property. Definitely will stay again at this hotel next time I am transiting in Sydney. It is the best airport hotel in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to Sydney Airport”
Reviews.Author: paulbnz
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern hotel. Nice dÃ©cor. Great and very large room (but I think I must have had an upgrade!). Very comfortable bed and pillows. Sadly I only had 8 hours there between flights. A shuttle bus will take you backwards and forwards to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Hopelessly inefficient and pillows like bricks”
Reviews.Author: MumDadAndTwoKids
Reviews.Content: The Grand entrance and the incredibly efficient Bell Boys is where my positive impression ends. After a 30 hour flight, all you want is the room that was requested. I requested a day room ($120) to be available from 9am and then paid for our room at a rate of $232 for room only (double room for a family). Instead we were directed to a dirty room that they laughingly call a hospitality lounge. Not much hospitality there I can assure you. Dirty coffee cups, no towels or products for the shower that we desperately wanted. No snacks - just an empty biscuit barrel. There was a TV and a couple of couches that we eventually shared with 20 odd other people (actually they were mostly on the floor). We arrived some 2 hours before the 20 odd other people - these poor travellers had been redirected to Australia due to ash clouds over NZ. There was no communication from hotel staff and definitely no understanding - 2 kids, 2 adults, a 30 hour flight and no hotel room at the end is NOT a winning combination As a note to those travelling with peanut allergy, this is probably not a great place to stay. As part of the hotel is a restaurant that specialises in Indonesian cooking (lots of peanuts). For us, the risk of contamination was too high so we ate elsewhere (there is a cafe next door) To top everything else, the pillows were like bricks. Not ideal and won't be staying there again. You kind of get the impression from the service and the staff that there is a very blase attitude. The hotel knows it is going to get business due to its location. No effort required.

Reviews.Title: “Still not a smoke-free hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emeste22
Reviews.Content: Stamford Plaza at Sydney Airport is an old Sheraton property and nothing has been done to enhance or upgrade the facility for many many years. The room allocated to me was a smoking room as no other rooms were available. The room had not been thoroughly serviced for a long time and this was revealed bu dust and rubbish behind the beds and fitting. Shabby and outdated furniture as well as food-soiled brochures and compendium reminded me that Stamford is really not amongst the top brands in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better for the price”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeetagain2
Reviews.Content: I checked into my one night stay at the Stamford at about 12 noon. When I went to my room there was two room service trays outside my room - presumably from the previous night and previous guest. The smell of old food was strong and it smelt like the trays contained the remnants of some sort of curry. The trays were still outside my room at 6.30pm, and of course still smelt. I would expect these food trays not to be left lying around for 24 hours or more? At $28.00 the room service breakfast was very expensive. I estimate it contained about $3.50 of supermarket cereal, mini croissants, juice and drip percolated coffee. Again, it was very ordinary. I would be happy to pay this price if the quality was offered in the food and produce. The room I stayed in was quiet, despite being near the airport. It was fairly spacious, but the dÃ©cor is looking a bit tired. There is a shuttle from the airport that costs $6.00. Given the airport is only a bit over a kilometre away - it seems expensive. Most airport hotels in other locations around the world offer a complimentary shuttle. I probably wouldnâ€™t bother staying here again as the prices were expensive for what was offered. A cheaper chain / budget motel would probably offer comparable or better value.

Reviews.Title: “Good quiet nights sleep before flight.”
Reviews.Author: Fourkiwis
Reviews.Content: One night stay before morning flight home. Rooms are very well insulated from airport noise, and are spacious and well appointed. Breakfast in the restaurant was very good. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK - not great, not bad, just OK”
Reviews.Author: hallyboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 2 nights in one of their deluxe rooms. Its location, opposite the entrance to the domestic airport, suited us as we had flown in from Brisbane fairly late and were picking up a hire car a couple of days later from near the hotel. On the full day in between we walked to Mascot station (10 minutes) and caught the train to Circular Quay (25 minutes), spending the day in/around Sydney. The room was quiet, reasonably sized and reasonably well equipped. It was not deluxe in my terms but it was OK. We had a buffet breakfast there on both mornings and, again, it was OK. We did not go hungry but I've seen better spreads in better settings.Two minor irritations. The safe in the deluxe room we were booked into was broken (as was one of the lights). We were offered another deluxe room which we accepted as we had hardly unpacked. The transfer was done quickly and efficiently but we could have done without that. Secondly, every wall picture and wall mirror was crooked. You could not straighten them because of the way they were fixed. The person who put them all on the wall must have had one eye lower than the other!

Reviews.Title: “Good nights layover”
Reviews.Author: Lost_in_Civilisation
Reviews.Content: After spending the weekend at a sibling's birthday, our BA flight was cancelled, and they put us up at the Stamford for the night. Included were dinner buffet coupons and breakfast coupons. The room was very decent, and there was no complaint about noise. The hotel is not new, but is kept in good condition and is totally functional if you want to stay near the airport. The hotel is just up the road (10mins) from Surrey Hills which has a million good restaurants and 15mins from the city. I would stay here if I had to layover or had business in the area. There is not much to do around this area. The restaurant food was good, and there are coffee shops located in the hotel for a good morning coffee. The rooms were clean, the bathrooms quite elegant, and overall not a bad room. Nothing special, but nothing to complain about either. Internet isn't free, but it isn't anywhere in Australia. I would stay here again if I had to, and even pay (Thanks BA for a free night). Stay here if you want to be close to the airport, stay in town if you want to sight see or go shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel okay, for God's sake don't eat in the restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: JaymoOslo
Reviews.Content: Room okay, bit worn but comfortable. Restaurant staff surly, unfriendly, argumentative. Food flavorless, yet quite expensive. Salt and pepper requested in attempt to make palatable, seemed to be viewed as a strange and annoying request. Sunday night April 10 2011 on the off chance anyone with the hotel cares. Lots more wrong with the place, but you get the picture.

Reviews.Title: “For avgeeks like me!”
Reviews.Author: aknavi
Reviews.Content: I love to stay here on the upper floors rm 1238 as I sit in the window couch and watch the planes come in. Very comfy room. Love the pool also. Food is more than passable. Usually great staff in the bar also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference thanks to the Stamford Plaza Sydney Airport”
Reviews.Author: BernHarris
Reviews.Content: I was a facilitator for a Conference held at the Stamford Plaza Sydney Airport last week. All I can say is the value for money was excellent, far superior to many other quotes received and the service and attention we all received made everyone of us feel very special.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, for a 1 night layover.”
Reviews.Author: thrPRICESareRIGHT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Australia day for a 1 day layover before flying to The Outback. Hotel is close and convenient to airport. Asked concierge where to go to get a few personal items and he said "everything was closed". This was not true. Also, when our car service came to look for us the door man told him we were not there after we told him where we would be sitting. It's a decent hotel for a night's stay, but I would not recommended it for any time longer. Room was clean, easy to sleep in and the hotel restaurant wasn't too bad. Overall it's a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but convenient”
Reviews.Author: AFLtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly and I love that I can easily walk between the hotel and the airport. There's a shuttle bus available but if you've got no luggage it's easier to walk. The outdoor pool is a nice refresher on sunny days too. The rooms themselves are beginning to look a little tired, and I'm no fan of shower curtains in a hotel bathroom. I was underwhelmed by the food options out of the mini-bar. Two bars of the same type of chocolate, two packs of the same type of chips, and two packs of nuts were all that was available. A little more variety would be welcome. The pricing of the room service menu needs to be more transparent too. The service is friendly and breakfast from the restaurant was tasty. I'm less impressed by the attempts at the hotel to empty your wallet. Room service prices are more expensive than the same items in the restaurant which is common, however a $6 tray charge also applies to small orders. Surely it's one or the other? Coffee and tea are dispensed from a new machine in the restaurant which had an "espresso" option which had been disabled. Espresso coffee is instead an extra $4.50 on top of your breakfast bill. Again, that's common, but if you put in an automatic machine then let it do what it can do. Don't disable options to try and make a little extra from your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Great view of the runway”
Reviews.Author: ulladulla
Reviews.Content: Needed to be close to airport for early start *** Double Glazed to enusre a perfect sleep for a early Start. All-round far superior ( in all aspects (Food/ Rooms/ Staff) than the Accor @ Brighton we had the misfortune to use. highly recommended thank you

Reviews.Title: “Perfect O'nite Stay”
Reviews.Author: gidget_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only overnight to see a concert in Sydney. The service,room (especially the beds),location,parking and proximity to the airport are the best we have experienced in any airport hotel and soooo quiet.. All the staff were happy,well groomed, helpful and prompt and we had a smooth check-in and out. No complaints here,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, good location to airport.”
Reviews.Author: mrsmusk
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight before going overseas. The instructions on the website said it was easy walking distance from the airport so we decided that is what we would do. The shuttle was going to cost us $13 each! (which is a massive ripoff). But we couldn't find our way out of the airport to walk to it so ended up having to take the shuttle. Our luggage didn't arrive with us and the hotel was very accommodating offering us some amenities until they turned up and specifically asking how late we wished to remain available for when it arrived. Beds were nice and comfortable, surprisingly we couldn't hear any aircraft noise despite being right at the terminal. No chance to check out the amenities though, only a quick stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: mezb
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 'family' room (two double beds), which were very comfy, with hubby and two small children. The room was clean, the bathroom was luxurious, huge bath, very nice. Room service very reasonable prices, quick service. Excellent value for mone, Sat. night, $205 which included parking and full buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you need to be near Sydney airport”
Reviews.Author: Reg_from_MN
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended highly by a guide book and a friend, and we were delighted with our stay. Big comfy room with a very modern bathroom. King sized bed was soft yet firm for a great night's rest. Though I could watch planes landing and taking off, I couldn't hear them. Enjoyed high tea upon arrival, and room service for dinner later and both topped our expectations. Staff was professional and extra helpful. Workout area was well stocked and we enjoyed a nice sauna. Minor quibbles: expensive wi fi; had to pay $6 for the super shuttle though the hotel is very close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “OK for last night of trip, but better to go downtown”
Reviews.Author: Jim_and_Barbie
Reviews.Content: We got a nice room here for the last night of our trip, and it worked out fine. The hotel is definitely close to the airport. If you really want to be by the airport, then I would recommend this hotel. However, in hindsight, it would have been better to pay the extra cab fare and stay somewhere closer to downtown, especially if it's the last night of your trip. Have dinner near the Opera House and enjoy being in Sydney. That's a better way to end a trip than watching the planes take off and land.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Airport Hotel with amazing view”
Reviews.Author: travelinfusion
Reviews.Content: We had a big, comfortable and modern room at the Stamford Plaza with an absolut brilliant view on the runway of Sydney Airport. We very much enjoyed our one night stay at this hotel. Unfortunately we had to pay for the pick up to the terminal next day. We expected to get this complimentary at an airport hotel of this high class!

Reviews.Title: “romantic honeymoon night package before o/s flight”
Reviews.Author: Buddenz
Reviews.Content: after much debate on whether to stay near the airport or in the city prior to flying o/s, we decided that a nice room in the stamford would have been the same price as a standard room at a nice hotel like the hilton or sofitel in the city, minus the worry of transfers. We had seen lots of bad reviews about sydney airport hotels but decided to take the chance anyway. We took the free transfer from the domestic terminal to the hotel. The lobby is very nice. We were taken to our room. The raffles suite, it was very nice. There were rose petals accross the floor, bath drawn, tealight candles, a bottle of Moet, a card that said happy honeymoon, a personalised bottle of wine, canapes and chocolate dipped strawberries WOW. It was lovely. We could see the time and temperature out the window as well as planes taking off. Double glazed windows meant no disturbance. Bed was comfy and we had room service dinner. I had steak and veg and it was amazing (even though basic), my husband had pasta and enjoyed it too. Room service breakfast was included. It was ok. Nothing fabulous but it came right on time as we had an early flight. We checked out and got the bus to the international terminal. THey even did some photocopying for us free of charge :) We were happy to stay and are glad we got a special online deal. I would stay here for a little overnighter splurge. sure there is no flat screen in the wall of the shower or in the lounge room, but that didn't worry us, the room was spacious and furnished with old style pieces which was nice for a change from the sterile harsh modern lines of other newer hotels. I hope that information helps :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice overnight”
Reviews.Author: RicoFan
Reviews.Content: Prior to a massive flight schedule the next day --- 24+ flight hours -- we enjoyed a great overnight at the Stamford -- upgraded to a small suite --- thank you Stamford --- the room was clean, comfortable and quiet --- appreciated -- the buffet dinner was somewhat unsatisfactory due to a party of 50-60 that took up a lot of tables and emptied the buffet but the breakfast the next morning was better

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Hawkzilla
Reviews.Content: Once again the hotel exceeds my expectation.The staff are really friendly and curteous,nothing is too much even though the lobby can sometimes look like a train station with people everywhere.This hotel is best for a one night stay before flying out which i was doing.A very good nights rest.Try the AV8 bar..good choice of of burger and beer and above all the friendly staff..The rooms are clean and very quiet and quiet spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Better service at formule 1 motels!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Snooki1985
Reviews.Content: Where to start? Stayed at the Stamford yesterday for nothing more but a quick getaway from the stressful week i had previous ,to arriving at the hotel needless to stay i left more stressed than i had been to begin with! Upon arrival there was no one available to help us get our luggage out of the car let alone take the car down to the valet parking that was included in our package we waited 10mins untill someone showed up yo help us out,the man then took my bag and left it literally in the middle of the lobby??? i kept my eye on it as i was speaking to someone at reception. I had made our reservation about 2 hours prior to arriving at the hotel and it was made via the phone! We had told the hotel that we wanted to pay for the room using cash not a credit card they said there would a $100 bond,which was fine but upon arrival we were also asked to hand over our credit card details to put a hold on some money even after we had given the the $100 bond??? i spent 15mins telling the man at the desk that i would refuse to hand over my credit card eventually he said that it was fine and i could just pay by cash! Before alll of this had happened they claimed that there was no reservation at all under our name????!!!! Finally made it up to the room,verything in the room was great other than having to pay $16.95 to watch one movie,which i thought was over priced (not even Formule1 charges that much!) I called for some more towels to be bought up to the room waited 20mins! Made a phone call to reception to have a wake up call and have a newspaper delivered to the room and if we could possibly have a late check out apparently everything was looked after,went out for dinner came back again no one was there to take our car we had to wait again......when someone did show up they said that the valet parking was for only one use and that we would have to pay $20 each time the car was bought up to us! I had had enough by this point so finally i asked for the District Manager he came out and said that i would have to pay for the valet parking and that it wasnt included in the package i said to him that i would go up to my room and bring my laptop down to show him what the package included, he agreed i bought the laptop down and began to look for the package but what do you know??? the package is no longer there! I said to him that the package wasnt there and that i will refuse to pay for the parking because even the man at check in said there would be valet parking included! He said that he would let it happen this time,i told him that i wouldnt be staying there again he really didnt seem to care which once again didnt surprise me!!!! Breakfast was awful even though it was a buffet breakfast! In conclusion i have never wanted to leave a hotel so soon, im not planning to go back there again i would rather stay at a formule 1 then go to this place and get treated the way we did these people have no idea at all about customer service,let alone general manners! One finally word to describe this hotel? Disgraceful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful!”
Reviews.Author: Glynis031
Reviews.Content: I arrived in a taxi at 9.15 pm with my 92 year old mother after a long flight. We were stopping overnight before continuing home. There was no-one to assist with our heavy luggage. Several young men having coffee near the hotel entrance witnessed my struggles and came to our assistance. The concierge team was non-existent. This was the worst welcome I have ever experienced. At the reception desk, the staff member said they had no record of my reservation, which had been made several months prior, and reconfirmed by me before I left for Europe. The breakfast was inedible. The charge for internet was totally unacceptable. The only positive comment concerns sound proofing, which was excellent. And, of course, the close proximity to the airport. Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “There must be better alternatives”
Reviews.Author: Rutman
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here on a one-night stop over prior to taking our transpacific flight home. I was amazed that an airport hotel did not offer a free shuttle. It cost us $24 each way. As with many foreign hotels, a double bed room is more like two large twin beds, so the sleeping quarters were pretty tight for our family of four. The bathroom was dirty. Reaching the front desk was impossible, even to schedule a wake up call. The internet cost was $29 a day. Breakfast for four was $128. On the positive side, the room was quiet. The bottom line: I will look for another option on my next layover in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned. Nightclub Below!!”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Gary
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel several times between flights. Never had a reason to complain before. However, last weekend I was allocated a room on the fifth floor that shares a common wall with the QANTAS Building next door. On Saturday night Dec 04 we were kept awake until 2.30am by pulsating and vibrating dance music from a nightclub next door to the hotel. So BE WARNED and if you want a peacful night do not accept a room that shares the common wall with the office block next door.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good - a great night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: nicket
Reviews.Content: A great place for an airport stopover if you can get it at the right price â€“ I usually book it at the last minute on â€˜wotifâ€™ or similar. Iâ€™ve stayed here many times and this is one of my first picksat Sydney airport. Iâ€™ve always found the staff to be genuinely warm and helpful and itâ€™s a comfortable place to stay. Comfy bed, good pillows and block out curtains. The rooms here are big and there is no noise from the airport â€“ itâ€™s always a good nightâ€™s sleep. The cost of parking is reasonable if you have to stay here with a car. There is an airport shuttle bus running regularly from the foyer. The Stamford is also a good choice if you need to be close to the city but donâ€™t have the budget to stay right in the heart of Sydney. Weâ€™ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Cant fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: benj1255118
Reviews.Content: We had a short stop over in sydney and needed a bed for the night. The Stamford is a short cab ride from the terminal. Hotel Staff were pleasant and helpful. The first hotel ever that actually had the baby cot in the room when we checked in. The hotel is located within walking distance (even with young kids) to a main street with shops ie. supermarket, cafe's, take away food and a few restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and Delightful”
Reviews.Author: dlturner007
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on a number of occasions and just keep coming back. The rooms are spacious, the staff are very friendly. I love the showers and the wonderful breakfast. My only advice would be if you are not a smoker make sure the room is odour free.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: oil710
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after 15 hour flight from Los Angeles and paid extra for early check-in. Room was OK, but starting to show its age. bed was great. Room size great. $29 for 24 hours of internet was rediculous. Got charged for mini-bar items we did not use. Skipped the restaurant and ordered in-room dinner which was as good as can be expected. Extra charges for EVERYTHING, even for settling with a credit card. Will not be back unless we have to.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: globallybusy
Reviews.Content: staff are unfriendly, hotel is way too noisy (the perfect storms of trains, cars and planes), ridiculously overpriced for a so-called 5-star hotel. the bed is also back-breakingly soft. i've stayed in 3-star hotels in developing countries which are cheaper and far nicer. even the breads at breakfast are stale. the only saving grace is its convenient for an over night stay close to the airport and has a "green stay" program where they give you a discount for not doing the linen on a daily basis.

Reviews.Title: “Great layover/Departure hotel”
Reviews.Author: At_The_Drive_In
Reviews.Content: I only ever stay in this hotel if I am flying out somewhere or for a layover or a late night arrival. Every time i have found the hotel to be very clean. VERY quiet. perfectly suited to buisness travelers. I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone who is not staying here for buisness of flight reasons. It is not a tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: BrentonandTina
Reviews.Content: we had a 1 night sleepover in sydney before venturing off overseas, and chose the Stamford as it is close to the airport. it really exceeded our expectations. i guess we expected quality due to teh name, but also expected perhaps a few glitches and noise issues due to its close proximity to the domestic airport. The concierge was amazing. to the point he even downloaded some info to help my 10 year old complete his homework on Sydney. the train station is an easy 5 - 10 minute walk ( concierge gives you an easy to follow map) expected to hear some noise. but NADA, not even the next morning when i was laying in a quiet room waiting for everyone else to wake up. if you are flying in. catch the super shuttle (i think thats what it is called) Taxi's get quite crusty as it is such a short journey. then when you are leaving, you can book a pick up, and they take you to whichever terminal you need. all up a great stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Standards have slipped”
Reviews.Author: MILLERSBowralnsw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped here one night following an overseas trip. We have stayed here a number of times before. This time it was very disappointing for the following reasons:- 1.I am sure they used to have filtered coffee but not any more 2.Mini bar list said there should have been 3 types of beer in the fridge. We only had one brand.We rang reception to make sure we wouldnt be charged for the others. They said that they dont put those brands in the mini bars now. Couldnt they have printed up new lists or left a note in each room. 3. There was no breakfast order form in the room. 4.There was no TV guide. 5. Only 1 cake of soap. 6.Towel had a brown stain about the size of a 50 cent piece on it. 7. Visible dust down the side of the mini bar Maybe we just got a bad room. However we got the impression that they cutting costs

Reviews.Title: “Wont stay again”
Reviews.Author: LouiseMaree
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as a one night stop over on way back from overseas holiday. Thought it would be better than it was considering I book rooms via this chain of hotels on a corporate basis within my day to day job. Big disappointment. Out of the 3 weeks we were away in the US, this was our most expensive outlay per night, welcome back to Australia. Room was OK. We had a meal in the restaurant, food was good but the staff were rubbish and quite rude. I've never had a waitress pour 2 glasses of water without lifting the bottle between glasses before! We were left to mop up the excess with our serviettes. Had to ask for cuttlery, had to even ask for the water and were pretty much ignored. And, they ask for a tip. What a joke. Didn't hear a plane even though it backs onto the airport. The room was noisey from the inside. After a long flight back to Australia, I was left laying awake listening to the elevator whirring up and down, insulation between rooms could be improved too.. Shuttle drivers, which I dont think are connected to the hotel, are also abrupt and rude and infact next time, I think I would prefer to walk. We have a lot to learn in this country about service. It doesn't cost anything to be polite, friendly and helpful. We left early the next morning and had breakfast at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulzE
Reviews.Content: Very close to Sydney airport, well appointed and a nice restaurant for that night before the flight meal.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location if you are flying out”
Reviews.Author: raura
Reviews.Content: Great location, right near the domestic airport (walking distance). A short cab ride to the international (they do offer a shuttle service as well). Easy to get to by car, but geting the right entrance into the parking is tricky. The parking lot is terrible - poorly sign posted, hard to find the lifts to the lobby. But cheap for $15 overnight. Very busy at check in, but not too long to wait. Room was fine - no aircraft noise due to double glazed windows. Nice, clean, but nothing special. Internet expensive. For an airport hotel (Australian standard), pretty good. Location is the key to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but convenient if travelling to Airport next day”
Reviews.Author: siienka
Reviews.Content: The Stamford Plaza hotel is in need of renovating! Decor is outdated and really nothing special about the in-room decor. The entrance to the hotel could also be jazzied up a bit! I wouldn't stay here again unless I have a flight the next day but may consider cheaper alternatives around the area instead. Customer service over the phone at reservations could be improved, be more professional, helpful & friendlier. But overall the actual hotel service was quite good though. Checked in smoothly & the room service serviceman was excellent. My partner & I wanted to order the Cheese platter & it was delivered swiftly even though we were told it was no longer on the menu at the time. He said it wouldn't be a problem & prepared it for us. Now that's what gives a hotel valuable feedback!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you pay the bill in Australian Dollars!”
Reviews.Author: TWMC2010
Reviews.Content: This is a nice modern hotel close to the airport, if you are driving there by hire car rehearse the root on Google maps or likewise first. The entrance is confusing and if you miss it you will spend several minutes in one way roads with no right or left turns where you need them. Even with SatNav we had trouble getting in and it took two attempts. The underground car park is confusing with bays for residents and guests and people parking behind each other, if you do this you have to leave your keys at the desk in case they need to move your car. Only one of the elevators from the car park lets you get to the lobby without a key card but this is not signposted very well. The signs about paying for parking are also confusing as there are no actual barriers or places to pay, apparently the signs are defunct but no one has taken them down. Once you are in the hotel it is well laid out and the rooms are spacious, clean and well maintained, the Hotel has a policy that if you keep your towels and linen you get a discount voucher for the restaurant which we did as it made the food price a bit more bearable. The staff are polite and helpful but it can get busy in the lobby, the hotel seems to be used by lots of pilots and cabin crew which I normally take as a good sign. If you are an international traveller make sure you pay in Australian Dollars when you check out, they will offer to convert the bill into your local currency to save you paying the conversion charge on your card; the hotels â€˜commissionâ€™ on the conversion is at least triple anything my card company has ever charged me.

Reviews.Title: “soundproofed from outside but not from inside”
Reviews.Author: yennha
Reviews.Content: since it's an airport hotel and mind you, you can watch the planes landing and taking off from the runway from your window, so close it is to the airport, your first worry must be the noise from outside. well they assure you that they have this 8mm thick windows that make sure you barely hear noise and that's true. the problem i had was the noise coming from inside th ebuilding! banging doors/loud talking at the hallway would wake me up regularly in the whole course of my stay. i arrived early in the morning but it was nice that they have this temporary waiting room where you can hang for awhile, with tv, coffee and even a shower to comfort you while killing time. room was pretty spacious. still quite old fashioned with the non-flat screen tv placed on a cabinet, the doors of which you have to open to watch tv. nice soft bed. cleaning crew not very consistent (there were times you get your room less cleaned up than other times) room service was satisfactory. they even serve food late at night which was very good while i was recovering from my jetlag and sleeping therefore eating at unconventional times. food in restaurant is not very delicious though. staff was not exactly a very attentive lot. the fact that it's like 10-15 minutes away form the international airport and 5 minutes away from the train was a good plus. Overall, it's a bit too pricy for what you actually get.

Reviews.Title: “One night was enough”
Reviews.Author: margnmike
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a stop over on the way home from an overseas trip. The check in was OK but no one was there to help us with 4 large suitcases. We had to find a luggage trolley ourselves and get the luggage up to our room. We were allocated a room that was designed for older/disabled guests so the shower had no curtain or screen and the bathroom had nowhere to hang anything as it had a sliding door. The bathroom looked like it was in the middle of renovations with grout smeared across the tiles, some tiles missing and some lights not working. The room itself was large and comfortable but so poorly lit we could have done with a torch. Had to ask for an ironing board as one was not provided in the room. Our bill at checkout included charges for items we had not used - so check it carefully! The hotel has a bus service from the international airport but it is not clearly signposted where you actually need to wait for it.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: RP2000
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over the internet after reading good reviews. Check in went well and had no problems. The room was clean but outside our door was the previous occupants used food tray which didn't look good and when we left our room in the morning it was still there!! On the evening of our stay we had dinner in the restaurant. The seafood buffet was good with no complaints about the food but the service was poor. In fact non-existent. We had to get the waitress' attention if we wanted anything. She just stood to the side of restaurant. At check out we had no problem until a few days later when I noticed that my credit card had been charged twice. The first amount was the amount that I signed off on with a further charge for my stay plus $2.50 which upon research was further charge for using a credit card. When I arrived home from overseas I telephoned them and was told they would look into it and get back to be on specifed day the follwoign when they day came as I had not heard from I called. Luckily this time the person was helpful and my account was recredited. Overall, I have a very poor opinion of this hotel and would NEVER stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel; great location; excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Vitz6
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights stopover from London to New Zealand. Enjoyed a very good stay here. 5 minute drive from airport, $30 taxi to city; excellent staff; very good gym; very good rooms (a bit dated); very nice breakfast. Cost was a bit on the high side as was the cost of wi-fi internet. Only quibble we have was with our taxi driver when we arrived! Was not pleased because we were only going practically around the corner - that we do appreciate - but that is your job!! We took the hotel's shuttle back to the airport when we left!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would reccommend”
Reviews.Author: gms88
Reviews.Content: I got booked into this hotel by my airline as I had missed my connection flight and i couldnt have been happier, i got a large spacious room with a huge bed and a luxurious bathroom. The staff were friendly and the hotel was quiet. Did not get to sample the food, but the room was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A night at the Stamford is worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Hawkzilla
Reviews.Content: I have just recently finished a weekend away with my partner; I selected the Stamford Hotel out of the many fine hotels in Sydney because its prestige and excellence really highlights its uniqueness. I was astounded from the very first step I took inside the hotel, calling the hotels theme â€œclassic brillianceâ€� would be underselling it. I had a room on level 11, it was peaceful and quiet. The romance package is defiantly worth the extra, rose petals lead you from the door into a candle light room (the chocolate strawberries are to die for). Room service was excellent, the Pizzas were delicious, the only problem I had was that after smelling the restraint downstairs, I was starving! To basically sum it up, if you are looking to escape with someone special, the daily drag of work, rekindle the passion...then the Stamford is your destination.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable haven”
Reviews.Author: NarobCanberra
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. The rooms were clean, comfortable and well sound proofed. The staff on the check in desk were efficient but not very friendly, but the bar staff and wait staff were friendly and helpful. The staff were also helpful with organising transfers to the airport.We enjoyed breakfast, lunch and dinner as well as a few cocktails. The curry puffs are light and very delicious! It is a good place to stay if you need to be if you are catching a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PacificTravellers
Reviews.Content: I often connect to internal flights within Australia via Sydney. This property is one of the best airport hotels I have stayed in. The rooms are really nice, well appointed, room service is very good. The staff are efficient and know what they are doing i.e. they are focused on making your thoroughfare smooth as possible. I recommend the airport views over the other side, just more to watch as you wittle away the waiting time. The facilities are good, however I have only ever checked in the evening and left the next day so canâ€™t comment beyond that. Transport services to/from the hotel are good and well ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a 1 nighter but”
Reviews.Author: SteffanOfSouthport
Reviews.Content: If you need to be near the airport this is the pick of the airport hotels, great food, and facilities but poor value compared with what you can get downtown. Good for a 1 nighter ok

Reviews.Title: “A great lay over for International travel”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye4077
Reviews.Content: We will be coming back! The Stamford is an easy flat walk from the domestic terminal (approx 1.5kn) - honestly with a basic level of fitness you acn walk here and avoid Sydney's rude taxi drivers! The service of reception staff and quality of the rooms were extremely good. Plenty of room for what we required. The early morning international shuttle bus is extremely popular so ensure you book the night before. The rooms are well appointed and with extra thick window glass you can enjoy the view but none of the noise of the area! We enjoyed a lovely dinner the night we arrived in the restuarant downstairs. The meals were prepared effeciently and delivered to our tables promptly. Two courses for four people for less than $150.00 - not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: davo969
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the stamford hotel last month in march. The lobby was very nice as you walk in you find it is a very classy and had a good feel about it, reception was very fast and had good knowledge about the facilities. Rooms were very clean and comfortable, AV8 bar was very very good they had good music playing which made it a very good place to relax and have a few drinks with mates. At the end of the night ordered room service the club sandwich was awesome. I would consider this hotel the best hotel at the sydney airport compared to the others around there 5/5 keep it up stamford :)

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could rate this higher - room service rip off”
Reviews.Author: mandmshow
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel - the convenience and location - as well as the park and fly option (you can leave your car undercover for a number of days as park of the accomdation packages) BUT it has room for improvement. The "night owl" aka after 11pm menu does not have a burger or a club sandwich available - THIS IS AN AIRPORT HOTEL !!! The nearest it has, for $18 AUD, is a toasted ham and cheese sandwich with the ham being the cheapest sandwhich ham imaginable served with some potato crisps. That is apalling. As others have said, rooms need work, but that would be bearable if price were proportionate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: stoffa
Reviews.Content: One night on a business trip before going to Bangkok, this hotel was good and more than I needed. Early check in for me was a problem as they were booked out. The hotel is tidy and my room was huge, I had a Deluxe Room which was perfect in all areas, clean and well appointed. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is quiet. Bar was nice and drink prices acceptable. Breakfast was a good standard. Transport by cab to airport is about AU$10.00, and getting a cab is no problem. The hotel was perfect for my needs and would stay there again if in transit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stop over Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 7_seas_traveler
Reviews.Content: Stamford is a name in Australia and provides hotels in Sydney Brisbane and Melbourne besides others. I gotta say that i am not Australian and therefore i probably expected more of hotel with the reputation, I read about. The room I was in could still be counted as a typical late 1990's room, you would have found in 4 star hotels around that time. Big TV tower holding a big TV(as in a box not flatscreen), heavy desk, heavy furniture etc. it did give the impression of elegence with the special wallpaper, which was somewhat made from linen. I saw this only once in the Sacher Hotel in Austria and that reminded me. I went for dinner twice in the restaurant and always before that to the bar to have a drink or two. i found out fast that the barman was a student or trainee, which reflected in his drinks, he made. The bar menu wasn't great anyway but I didn't bother. There are many different ways to enhance things with little or no effort but the hotel has to figure that out by itself. While i was sitting in the restaurant, i spotted an obviously higher manager. The supervisor almost jumped from another table to him to great him. It was maybe the hotel manager or so. However i didn't like it. Because while he got treated as a VIP other guests suffered from that. And please do not believe that nobody recognized that he got his food first while coming to the table later. The guest don't know, who gets treated there and even if it was the manager, he has to step back and advice his staff to serve the guests first instead of him!!! The food was above average. I can say that because I ate toom much on both occasions, I went to the restaurant. i also went to the gym to have a swim in the pool, which was outdoors. I didn't mind that it was a bit cold outside. I just hd a problem with the pool and surounding area being dirty! On my check out day, I still had some time, so I ate breakfast outside at a small openair cafe. it looked a bit like an imbiss and a bit overprized for what was available. I would return to the Stamford, if there is no alternative. It was not too bad but also not better than a Hilton or one of the Accor Hotels. The staff was friendly but only within their limits. I did not recognize an "Extra Mile" effort. The hotel is maybe an Australian 4 Star. In Europe it would be only 3.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Dom-Michelle
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is about 15 minutes from the airport, they do not have a shuttle, but you can take a shuttle that deserves the hotels for $6.00 per person each way. The room was big and cozy, the concierge very helpful. It is pretty far from The Opera House and Darling Harbour though, the easy way to get there is a cab. The cheap way is the bus, we tried it, it was quite an adventure as you need to change line once. But it is possible and the drivers were helpful. The swimming pool looked nice, we spent a very good night there, the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Meh - okay, but lacks attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Pixanne
Reviews.Content: We booked one night here as a stopover after our flight from London to Sydney and before our connection to Byron Bay. Check in was fine (after an incredibly rude taxi driver) and our room was a fabulous size and had all the amenities we could wish for. On the whole, it was fairly clean but our room service breakfast menu and bar check had both been filled in by the previous guest and not replaced. Toiletries, glasses and tea cups had been laid as if the hotel were only expecting one guest and not two - although our booking clearly stated two. After a 21 hour flight, we were so tired we'd have slept standing up, but this hotel is what it is - an airport hotel. It could be improved with more attention to detail. That said, the breakfast buffet was great and there was no extra charge for my brother joining us for a coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lyfs4travLn
Reviews.Content: A great hotel to stay at, all of the staff from doorman, concierge and desk were polite and attentive and facilities I would expect from a decent hotel in town. So close to the airport, in fact I could see it from the airport runway when I arrived, great room, soundproof due to double glazing, I could see the city, Anzac Harbour bridge from my 9th floor corner room. Did not use the hotel bar or resturant as it was only a one night stay and I spent most of my time in the city. Took the bus ($5) from the international terminal to the domestic and had intended to walk from there as the hotel is so close but the bus kindly dropped me off across the road on its circuit back. Check in a breeze even though the hotel was busy (its conference season apparently) A convenience store is located within the building as is an outdoor cafe. The only thing that could have been better is its location to the nearest train station Mascot, which is a couple of blocks away, quite a nice walk but limiting if you are on your own and returning from the city in the evening, (best to take a taxi) the Holiday Inn location would be the best option for convenience with public transport. Train system into town excellent, I bought an all day pass $22 which covers train, bus and ferry for that day. Booked a shuttle back to the airport next afternoon only $8 and was dropped off outside my airline check in area. Gotta say the Aussies have great customer service and that says quite alot coming from a Kiwi. For discount shopping in the city try Birkenhead Mall, 20 min bus ride easy to reach, any bus starting from 500...from Circular Quay tell the driver and you will see the mall beside the harbour as you cross the 2nd bridge after Anzac Bridge, just a short walk and even shorter back as the return bus stop is closer. Food court, cafes, supermarket, fruit shop and good shopping for all ages

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmhholiday
Reviews.Content: Due to severe weather conditions in the UK and Europe and a delay in returing to Sydney, I needed to find a hotel for one night's stay in January. Booked this hotel via relatives whilst in transit from London Heathrow to Singapore. Booking was relatively easy and on arrival at the hotel later on a Sunday night, everything was handled very efficiently. The reception was friendly, informative and indeed one of the better experiences in weeks of travelling overseas. A room upgrade was an added and unpected bonus as was the inclusion of breakfast the next morning. The room was on one of the higher floors with no street or airpcraft noise. Bedding was clean and the room was extremely large. A great hotel and centrally located within a short walk to Mascot shopping centre. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: iflynrvtoronto
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 months planning our 5 week excursion to Australia, 95% of my bookings for hotels, excursions was from reading trip advisor and the only hotel i was disappointed with was this one. We paid 260 for a deluxe room for one nite with a view of the airport, my partner works for Air Canada and i'm plane nut) We booked the hotel shuttle to pick us up, no show and it was raining. We got to the hotel, and we where assigned room 1111, (i had previously read to make sure to get a renovated room) the gentleman who checked us in said that the room was preselected for us so he assumed it was. It most definitely was not, the building looks to be built late early 70's and our room was original, the carpet was dirty/ stained, no blanket and both the robes where very whether ed. We went out for diner in town and arrived back at around 11pm, at 12 am we asked to be moved to another room, we where moved, the room was bigger but everything was original and tired. I don't mind paying (by far our stand out favourite hotel was the Marriott - Surfer's paradise, unreal service and very nice hotel) but at 260 a nite i really did expect more. I would recommend this hotel only on its proximity to the airport (ibis is 1/2 a block away at i'm sure at my lower rate) We did take the morning shuttle with another couple that said they had a nice / renovated room, so perhaps if you can make sure you get one of those rooms it would be ok. We did not. We stayed at the Emporium in Brisbane great hotel but on the outer limits of the city and the Stamford Plaza on the waterfront looked very nice and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: citizen_kane_2009
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay in this hotel! It is located at the airport but there is absolutely no noise from planes. Getting to the city center is relatively easy, a 5-10 minute walk to the closest city rail station (Mascot) and a 20-minute trip with train. Internet at the lobby is 8 AUD for half an hour and transportation to the airport with the hotel shuttle is 6 AUD per person. There is also a convenience store right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good airport choice”
Reviews.Author: padredave
Reviews.Content: We found the check in, location and in house restaurant to be very favorable. The place is quiet despite being so close to the airport. The staff during our one day there was very pleasant and very helpful. If I were staying again in this area and had a full day like we did I would most likely consider the Holiday Inn nearby as it is five blocks closer to the train station for downtown. Otherwise I cannot find any major faults with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location close to airport, severly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: IdRatherBeAtHome
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average - the decor is in bad need of refurbishment, phone did not work and when it did it took the operator front desk person 2 minutes to answer it (must have fallen asleep or gone for a cigarette). Service was bad. The location of the hotel is great. You can take a shuttle or a ten dollar cab ride to airport(the shuttle is not FREE). At $240.00 for this, which included breakfast which did not open until 6am located near an airport where international flights leave at the aerly hours, was rediculous to say the least. Get with the times. Also if you arrive after 11pm, forget room service unless you want chips from the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but good location”
Reviews.Author: expatsing
Reviews.Content: I don`t like Airport Hotels. I avoid staying at these as much as I can. I had no choice but to book this hotel as I could walk to see my customer from there. The hotel is not too bad. I had one of the "Deluxe floors", which does not really give any privilege, except I guess that the rooms must be in better conditions. Decor needs to be refurbished, but bed was comfortable.Service was ok, nothing to write to your mother about. Two main highlights: Location. The location of the hotel is great. You can take a shuttle (Not FREE, they will charge your room). Turn right at the airport exit and go to the bus section, on section 33. There is one every half hour or so. The second highlight is the price. $240.00 for this just does not make sense to me, location or not.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but if you choose here get a room on a high floor”
Reviews.Author: Brocko25
Reviews.Content: At $220 per night, this hotel is charging for location. The beds are comfortable, but the rooms are tired. This was once the Sheraton in a former life, and I doubt much has been done to the rooms or corridors since then by the look of it. Distinct 90's 4-5 star vibe. Also, the airport transfers are no longer free so if you are travelling with 2 or more people, a taxi will be cheaper to the airport than their shuttle ($6 per person). They tried to charge me for the shuttle on check-out, even though I never used it. So be sure to check your bill. We had a room on the third floor, which despite the double glazing we could hear the freight trains on the train line that runs past the hotel (late night and early morning also). For the price, I will not stay here again. Too expensive for their tired product offering. But the bed was comfortable. Check out was friendly (despite the overcharging, and the fact it was 4am), but on check-in I was barely grunted at. Just the luck of the draw if you get friendly service, like most places I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Airport Stay”
Reviews.Author: dhbrose
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night to provide an easy start for a morning flight. Very nice room that was surprisingly quiet despite being next to the airport. Room included buffet breakfast, which was a good start for the next morning. The below ground car parking garage is a hassle with 2-3 cars per stall requiring the concierge to move cars around when you are ready to leave. The hotel charges for the airport shuttle. $16/person when we stayed. If you have a rental car it may be better to keep it and pay the $10/night parking fee and drive yourself across the street to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “It's an airport hotel - and it also has a car park”
Reviews.Author: Peachgone
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in three airport hotels in Sydney and this one is the best. Rates are acceptable rooms are clean. I'm never there for meals as that generally happens at the airport but the car park is undercover and considering long term car park rates at Kingsford Smith this place is great value. My wife and I have stayed here twice. We arrive late at night, leave the car in the car park and catch early morning flights the following day to return in a week. We have had no troubles. For me it's an inexpensive car park that provides a comfy bed and has a mini bar!

Reviews.Title: “As I got a Smoking Room in Australia I'll Forgive Anything”
Reviews.Author: ButtsFife
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is dead handy for The Airport but a bit far out for tourisitic purposes - although you can walk to the Airport (Domestic Terminal) and catch the Train into Sydney. I downgraded my room (how often do you hear that) to get a Smoking Room. I know its sad but these are as rare as hens teeth in Australia. The room was perfectly adequate with two double beds and a decent bathroom. I had breakfast once (8 night stay) which was on special offer at $17 for a full cooked and continental ( not bad for this type of hotel) I had 2 daytrips one to Melbourne and one to Canberra that's why I stayed near the Airport - the rest of the time was spent in Sydney via the Expensive Railink from the Airport. Had a slight problem on checkout when $132 had been charged to my room for food by someone - but it was soon sorted out !!!

Reviews.Title: “All good, clean hotel, clean rooms, great gym but poor buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Appreci8life
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel easily. Parking was ok though you may have to navigate a little around the carpark. Parking fee was reasonable at only $10 per night. No complaints from me. The hotel is stylish, the rooms are clean, the lobby is nice, the restaurant was also very elegant. The only big dissapointment was the buffet breakfast which was the crappiest I've ever had in an upmarket hotel. The bacon was the fattest I have ever seen and also looked barely cooked, the scrambled eggs looked very watery somehow and the sausages had a very unappetising colour. The rest of the buffet breakfast was ok. The hotel was good value and we also liked the fish water feature at the front of the hotel. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loquita23
