Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on our way over to South America, and also for one night on our way back. The photos are of the first room, which had darker wood furnishings. The 2nd room (no photos) was identical except with lighter wood furnishings, which did make a difference and lightened up the room and bathroom. They gave us a very good rate, and the hotel was more than comfortable. It is extremely close to the domestic and international terminals (about 5-7 minutes) and the hotel has a shuttle which operates approx. every half hour to and from both airports. The rooms on both occasions were extremely clean and spacious with 2 large queen beds, a great view of the airport, and a large, immaculate bathroom with all the usual amenities. We also tried the dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaurant on the first stay, and both were of excellent quality. The staff were very efficient and helpful. Would definitely recommend staying here to anyone needing a comfortable/luxurious and modern place to stay when in transit in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: megjo
Reviews.Content: Check-in was cold and unfriendly. The car parking arrangements are confusing at best with poor signage/explanation. The rooms are old, neglected and fatigue dirty. This hotel doesn't have to try because of it's location. I would rather travel 20-30 mins in a taxi and be cared about in a clean, modern room then stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Choose any other airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SandraAsh
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a one night stay between a flight from Christchurch, NZ and my returning flight to the states. A previous stay in a hotel close to the Sydney Opera House was totally without complaint. I travel often and all over the world. I have previously never written anything negative about any hotel, beleving that slipups occur in large operations. However, I simply want to have travelers avoid this place until cleanliness becomes a priority. The chairs in the rooms have dirty streaks particularly down the center. Dirt and dust coat the mopboards. The sheets look clean enough, but are so thin that the single, too narrow mattress pad shows through. The white sheets encasing a blanket are the only items besides the foam or lumpy polyester pillows on the bed, so this is a plus! In the restaurant, the host/manager tried two chairs until he found a clean one for me to sit on. We asked for some of the glassware to be changed for clean items. One could write a name in the dirt and dust on the glass cocktail tables in the bar lounge and on window ledges. Shelves showcasing items for sale in the lobby where coated in dirt and dust. I would really like a hotel rating committee to stop by soon. I have never seen any other lodging this far from it's rating and so not worth the Australian $170.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the Airport - Sky high Internet”
Reviews.Author: mspaddler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel prior to a morning flight back to the US. Room was very nice, staff also very pleasant. However, the charge for internet access is the most I have ever paid. They charge 55cents per minute with a maximum daily charge of 29AU$.

Reviews.Title: “The "Jet Lag" package is rip-off”
Reviews.Author: fit2fly
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked 2 rooms as part of the "Jet Lag" package between flights, as we had a 10 hour layover after a long trans-Pacific flight. We were told 2 days before our arrival by the Hotel Reservation Supervisor that our rooms were guaranteed for arrival by 6:00 a.m. When we got there, however, we were told we could not check in until 2:00 pm, as the hotel was full the night before, and despite what they had said earlier, the Jet Lag package did not guarantee an early check-in. Waiting until 1400 hrs was more than an inconvenience, as we had to leave for the airport for our next flight at 1530 hrs. I had a couple of rounds with the management at the hotel - the Supervisor who had told us we could check in was not on duty. After some considerable complaining on my part, they came up with one smoking room (we asked for non-smoking) and later found a second room on another floor. Also, the room we got had such a strong smell of disinfectant, it burned our throats, but it was all that was available when we checked in. The manager on duty tried to sooth things over by handing us 2 "Jet lag" packages (some lotions basically). One of them was incomplete. The hotel was so noisy that after 2 hours sleep, we were woken by the sounds of housekeeping slamming the doors systematically down the hall. When we checkout out, the clerk barely looked at us, and was, frankly, rude. We were an absolute travesty from the moment we walked into the hotel. I have used "day rooms" in London and Frankfurt, and never had any problems. This was a truly horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: dickfos76
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with family, as i was early flight from Syd and in-laws arriving on an even earlier flight from UK. The hotel was easy enough to discover, check-in was efficient and precise, although the directions were understandable to the car park, finding a park was a bit of a process (double parking). Rooms were spacious and clean enough with 2 queens and enough space to put travel cot in as well. Didn't use many of the facilities, kids attempted to use the pool, but the advertised heated pool was not. Did take up the offer of full buffet b/fast in the morning, which at $17pp was quite reasonable and the food abundant and delicious. Overall, extremely convenient to airport, great mystery offer deal $105, nice way to greet the family!

Reviews.Title: “Good, nice and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: ellietia
Reviews.Content: I took the punt and booked a secret wotif hotel near the airport, thought I'd narrowed it down to the Mecure but it turned out to be the Stamford, bargain at $110 a night for 2 double bed room. Check in was quick, a bit vague with directions ie car parking considering we haven't been here before and I was travelling alone with 2 children. Found the carpark and had to follow a man to my car space which I found confusing but finally found it. One member of concierge must of took pity on me and was excellent for the rest of the stay, wished I'd gotten his name. We had an early morning flight to Melbourne the next morning and this man suggested we take a taxi and not the shuttle, I was a bit worried about a taxi taking us this close to the airport but the concierge man was there the next morning and grabbed us a taxi and made sure he took us to the domestic terminal. Excellent service...I decided to leave my car at the Stamford while away and he quickly got that sorted out for me, $10 a night was the cost. On arrival back into Sydney taxi driver wasn't too pleased about the short fare back to the Stamford but this time my husband and older son were with us so he more or less reluctantly agreed and kept the $7 change. Taxi cost to domestic terminal from Stamford was $10, cost from Sydney domestic back to Stamford $13 and he kept the change. As soon as we pulled up at the Stamford this man was out the front and remembered us and went and got our keys for my husband to get the car. All very smooth and quick, he really was excellent.. The Stamford was nice, we were on the 9th floor with a view over the pool and nothing much else, room was clean and tidy with mini bar. Personally I would not stay here again, nothing to do with the service or location but I don't like high buildings and rooms with no balconies, now thats just a personal thing and in no way a reflection of the Stamford qualities, if these don't worry you it's a great place to stay and very close to the airport. I just felt that having 2 children with me there was no room to move outside of the building, no grounds where they could play, so we walked into Botany twice and had lunch and dinner there. Easy 10-15 minute walk from the Stamford with plenty of eateries to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayKickers
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 1 night before an early flight back to NZ. We really enjoyed our stay at the Stamford and would happily of stayed for more than 1 night!! Our room was huge and presented well with great sized bathroom as well. Fantastic rooftop pool & spa area, water temperature in the swimming pool was great. We had a good dinner at the AV8 bar/restaurant at the hotel at a reasonable price. Staff were friendly & helpful. Would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Meetings”
Reviews.Author: Brisvegas_mel
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have organised a meeting at the Stamford, but the first time I have stayed at the hotel. The process in getting the meeting organised went smoothly and everything was as requested in this regards. I found the meeting area quiet and our room was perfect for our needs. The Conference staff were also very professional and attentive - this is one of the key things I look for when arranging meetings/conferences. The hotel itself is in a great location when you have delegates arriving from various states - very central. It is a short 15 minute walk from the airport if you want to stretch your legs after a flight, or a shuttle bus service runs regularly at a cost of $6 return (I believe, we only used it one way). Check-in went smoothly and quickly and the I found my room on the 9th floor to be spacious. The bed was one of the biggest and most comfortable I have slept on in a hotel for a very long time. The view was okay, although I would have liked to have been on the airport side of the hotel as I believe the view of the runways is spectacular - if you like that sort of thing. My only real complaint - and this is a usual one with me when it comes to travel within Oz - is the outrageous cost of the internet. $0.55 cents per minute, capped at $29 - so when it reaches $29 you pay no more for the 24 hour period. Again I just think that a business hotel should be offering free internet to its guests or at the very least a reasonably priced internet. When I can put $40 per month for 25g of high-speed internet at home, I just don't understand the gouging that goes on in regards to hotel wifi. Anyway that will no doubt continue to be my whinge. We ate in The Grove restaurant and enjoyed a delicious seafood buffet at $55 per head which I thought was very reasonable. They had a good variety of cold seafood (the oysters were great) and hot dishes were also on offer. The desert selection was too good! We also had breakfast in The Grove and again the buffet breakfast was fantastic value for money at $15 for continental or $17 for hot/cold buffet. I went with the Continental and there was a lovely variety of cereals, fresh fruit and pastries. A couple of colleagues had the hot breakfast which included made-to-order omlettes which looked delicious. The catering for our meeting was great - the fresh fruit tartlets were a huge hit. Lunch was again in The Grove, but as our meeting was only small it wasn't worth them doing a buffet again, so we were given a limited choice menu to complete at morning tea so our lunches were ready when we were. Again delicious food - the chef is very good and his mustard sauce (served on grilled fish in my case) was divine, but he wouldn't give away his secret. We found all the staff to be pleasant, helpful and friendly. My only other complaint is that you needed your room card to get the lift to work and we all struggled with this throughout our stay. But other than that it was very pleasant. I am organising a similar meeting in a few weeks and will be happy to use the Stamford again, quite reasonably priced for a Sydney Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JWSFlorida
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very high quality and surpisingly nice. I wouldn't just consider it a nice airport hotel, but a nice hotel in general. We stayed one night prior to our flight out the next morning following our tour of Australia. Frankly, we would have been happy if this hotel was down on the Circular Quay and our main hotel because it was that nice. A great and comfortable place to stay if you need to be near the airport. The quietest hotel of our entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: C0nstantlyOnTheG0
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here numerous times when we've had a morning flight. It normally offers the best rate and facilities for an airport hotel in Sydney. Check-in is always without a hitch and if you require car-parking, there are normally packages to leave your car for a period, which are reasonable. We generally use the hotel shuttle to get to the airport, which gets you to either terminal quickly, which runs every 20 minutes in the morning. There is now a small charge for this service; approx $4? However, we do not recommend using the service on arrival back into Sydney. We have had to wait, for long periods to be collected and it normally results in a phone call to the hotel. After an all night flight that's the last thing you want. On one occasion we waited for over an hour. Taxi's aren't keen to take you the short distance back to the hotel, but atleast you're back at the hotel quickly. If there's a few of you, a taxi would be cheaper than the shuttle. The rooms are clean and are of a 4 star standard. We utilise the room offerring 2 doubles and although it's a little tight for 4, (ie 3 teenagers and parent) it's manageable. The restaurant is acceptable for the establishment, but you are paying 4 star prices. Breakfast is easily purchased at the airport and generally the cheaper option. However, travel agents have been offerring better deals than on line or direct through the hotel, as they have been able to get breakfast included; again this depends on your departure, whether you can utilise breakfast. We're happy staying here before departure from Sydney, but strictly as an airport hotel. I wouldn't recommend here for tourists visiting Sydney as it is a transit hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel when everything goes as planned”
Reviews.Author: 1_aussie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early July 2009. After reading the reviews here I was quite nervous that I would end up regretting my stay. Much the opposite as it turned out; I checked out feeling rather satisfied with the how things went. I could have booked a $70AU private ensuite hostel room within minutes of Sydney Central, however given the views on offer, I decided to pay the extra $100 and book a room at this hotel. I booked through the hotel's website and paid the $20 upgrade for a room with Airport views. The 'jaw-dropping' views were well worth it indeed if you are interested in that sort of thing. My room was very clean, all listed appliances and features were present and in working order upon my arrival. Its not an easy job being a hotel housekeeper - so I give these staff high praise for their service. I did not try room service or the hotel's bar/restaurant. I believe I was entitled to access the hotelâ€™s pool and gym, although I did not have time to visit these features. Given its location, I still found the hotel to be rather quiet - although my room was at the end of the corridor and high from street level which helps! Sydney airport has a curfew between 11pm-6am, although some planes have their engines on at stages during the night due to maintenance which takes place across the road form the hotel. Again though, I didn't find this to be a problem. I was looking forward to using my Qantas frequent flyer card to earn some points(miles) for my stay, although after asking at checkout I was informed that there was minimum of $265 needed to be spent during my stay. As my room was less then this, I did not end up spending enough money to qualify for frequent flyer points. This must have been listed somewhere deep within the fine-print me thinks! Other then that, I was very happy with my stay and hope to return to the hotel later this year. I guess only then will I be able to get a more accurate idea of whether or this is a â€˜goodâ€™ or â€˜badâ€™ hotel. Staying on the 10th floor does sound more appealing then staying on the 3rd floor and perhaps the fact that I was a solo traveler, instead of a family or larger group, meant that it was somewhat easier for the hotel to meet any specific requests I had (although I didnâ€™t have any other then an airport view) I do advise all travellers to always call or email your hotel about a week prior to arrival; to double check points such as: *Confirmation of booking (donâ€™t rely on the automated email responses) *To ask any questions about specific features of the hotel and how they relate to your stay *To double check if the hotel can meet any of your requests ie. Airport transfers, awareness of party size â€“ if you are travelling in a group, confirmation of room allocation etc. I did this, printed out and brought a copy of their reply email with me during my stay. That way if things didnâ€™t go as planned, I could always show staff the email as proof. I'd be happy to answer any other questions.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: ajfNZ
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three and stayed one night at the Stamford Plaza Sydney Airport at the end of a wonderful holiday in June 2009. We chose to stay at an airport hotel to avoid an unnecessarily early start for our three year old daughter the morning we were to fly home. In a word - it was AWFUL. The building is old and tired. The airconditioning did not work effectively and our room was like a sauna. The room was not well cleaned and the beds were not comfortable. The room was missing basic things like a bottle opener and the alarm clock burst into life at 3am. In addition the service was the worst that we have ever encountered anywhere. The check in staff were efficient but unfriendly and volunteered none of the usual information you expect on check in. The porters were rude and unhelpful resulting in us pushing the trolley with our bags on it to our room ourselves and then returning it to reception. The housekeeping staff effectively told us to look harder when we advised that we were unable to locate a bottle opener in our room! The only friendly staff we encountered were in the bar and we appreciated it! Families with children are not welcomed at this hotel. We wanted to dine in the AV8 restaurant the evening we arrived but found that the childrens' menu was not available - it could only be ordered through room service. As a result the three of us returned to our room and sat cooped up together in our stifling room on a bed as we had a very average room service dinner. As matters transpired we would have been better off remaining at our very well appointed serviced apartment in the city than staying close to the airport. That is because although we requested a taxi to the airport half an hour before we required it , the porter did nothing to facilitate it and we were left stranded on the forecourt for an extra twenty minutes. Frankly, the place needs a bulldozer and the staff need to consider careers outside hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Stay”
Reviews.Author: sonatinakl
Reviews.Content: Convenient and efficient hotel. Just what I wanted at the tail end of a tiring trip down under. Convenient shuttle (chatty Russian driver!!)from their domestic airport to the hotel at a reasonable $6 (same price to the international airport!). Didnâ€™t have to wait too long for my room key in spite of a busload of people all coming in at the same time. Room was surprisingly large and comfortable with all the comforts of a deluxe international hotel. Room service food was again a pleasant surprise the Asian food was the best I had in Sydney! As a lady traveller security is constantly on my mind and I felt much better with lift security feature with this hotel. They seem to have quite a few hotels in australia and after my stay here I'll probably stay with the others on my next trip down under. All in all enjoyed my stay and was revitalized for my onward journey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Food.”
Reviews.Author: Hellen663
Reviews.Content: Getting to the hotel from the airport is fast and easy. Eating there was a an experience by itself. Food in Grove Restqurent is totally different to boaring hotel foods as it gets to be the same after a while. The menu does appeal to both spicy and non spicy food lovers. Highly recomended. Hellen Rkumar Wieten.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a layover”
Reviews.Author: SFscott413
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay the one night we were in Sydney before heading home. This hotel is right off the airport grounds (AUS$6 cab fare), including views of the airport. It's a very large, roomy hotel - and we got it at a very good rate on hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “ok for airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: dana_christian
Reviews.Content: I do not understand all the bad reviews. We stayed two days at this hotel and it was really okay. The room was clean and big and there was no real reason to complain. The breakfast was horrible indeed, but this can be avoided. It is not a high class 5star but acceptable for the money we paid. We did not hear anything from the nearby airport, but we had a great view on it from our room.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: caramellokoala
Reviews.Content: Booked a kingsize bed, ended up with twin beds. The bath mat and towels had seen better days. We were charged without our consent for transfers from the airport. Won't stay here anymore. For an extra six dollars you can go into the city and get a better priced and more comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I do not look forward to staying here”
Reviews.Author: andyoz
Reviews.Content: I am becoming more and more dissatisfied with Stamford Hotels right accross the board, they just never seem to get it right, they just don't "get it", there is always something "not right". It is certainly not the luxury chain it was and comes across as a hotel chain charging premium prices for an inferior product. This is obviously coming from head management but stems down to what we the customer ultimately gets. This hotel is no exception, however my last stay was not too bad (I stay here a few times a year as it's a company contract). Location is great for the domestic airport, you can even walk the 10 mins to the terminal (not international) if you don't have much luggage however there is a shuttle to both domestic and international for a fee of $6.00 which must be pre booked and leaves about every 30 mins. It's a busy hotel. Checking in and out can take some time when there is a queue. I have never had a problem with front desk, booking has always been found and the staff are courteous. The rooms however look very different to those on the hotel website, I could swear it's a different hotel. They are however quite good but unchanged from 15 years ago when I first stayed there, just after it opened as the Sheraton. My last room was good, spacious, very clean, and a very comfortable queen bed. Lighting is adequate and bed lamps have 2 settings. There is a desk with internet access and 2 phones (one bedside). TV is local and cable. Bathroom is good and comes with all amenities, good thick towels and plenty of them however the shower is over the tub which appears very low and uninviting if you want a soak. As with most hotels in Australia now the shower has a water saver head but I was suprised by the pressure, it was pretty good. I have never dined in the restaurant here but be warned, room service is a complete rip off. It's expensive, there is a $6.00 tray delivery charge and the quality is appalling. The one time I did order I sent it back and refused to pay. I ordered a sandwich which sounded great on the menu. When it arrived I just laughed. Two slices of supermarket bread with a slice of turkey in the middle and a handful of packet crisps on the side, $18.00 plus $6.00 delivery. A complete con. This is a hotel taking advantage of us, the customer, as there is really no where else to get food. That is a big gripe of mine. I have noticed a McDonalds has opened near by so this stay I resorted to that. I don't mind paying if it's quality but the food at this hotel is far from that. If you are after a decent airport hotel around Sydney this is your only choice as the only other alternatives are Ibis, Formule 1, Holiday Inn (ex Parkroyal) or Mercure (ex Hilton) which is on the other side of the airport. Quest have recently opened serviced apartments opposite the Stamford and have heard it's not bad. Have stayed at Holiday Inn and found it pretty basic. This hotel serves it's purpose and the rooms are comfortable. When it opened it was branded as a Sheraton, Stamford have not kept up the standard.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and restaurant are a disgrace”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: Rooms are extremely worn and jaded and in desperate need of a refurbish. The restuarant was a disgrace. The Hamburger patty was a frozen reworked supermarket patty. The salad on the burger was as disgraceful and the hand cut fries were stright from the chip packet. My wifes dim sums were from the same variety. A burger for $16 ?? An Absolute disgrace. The service was less than decent. We waited nearly an hour for that really simple food. We will NO WAY return. Give this hotel a wide berth . The Holiday Inn down the road is better. Not by a lot but at least better

Reviews.Title: “We Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: divinefeeling
Reviews.Content: We have always had a great stay in this Hotel. Reception staff can be a bit hit and miss, they had problems with our booking this time though nothing that was a big drama. Our room was great, airport view and a good size. Concierge was great organising taxi for myself and toddler while hubby was in conference. Great value and handy to airport. Room service for dinner was good. Breakfast was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - never again”
Reviews.Author: Cosmicgirl777
Reviews.Content: We booked the accommodation over the internet, and were both looking forward to our stay at what we thought was a reputable hotel. Our check-in encounter was less than expected, with only one employee dealing with all check-ins and enquiries at that particular time. The female employee that eventually served us hardly went out of her way at all to make us feel welcome. There were no instructions on the facilities available or any help with parking our car. We also did not receive any help to carry our baggage, not even any offers. We were then left to figure out which floor our room was on and how to park our car. On subsequent return to the hotel in our vehicle on two other occasions (late at night), we found that the car park gate was shut and we had to make our way around to the reception area to rouse a staff member to open the gate for us. (This is not an easy task if you are in your car down the driveway â€“ possibly just a key to open the door would be easier?) On arrival at our room, we found that our mini-bar key was not working and there were no bathrobes made available for our use (the information on the internet stipulated that there were bathrobes supplied). Furthermore, the shower pressure was very low, making it difficult to shower/clean oneself. We were also looking forward to having thorough work-outs in the gym, however found that a lot of the machinery was faulty or broken (two rowing machines, a bike, a treadmill, a chin/dip machine). The air-conditioning appeared to be too low or out of order because it was extremely hot inside the gym. There were no towels and also no cups to have a drink of water. To top it all off, the spa was out of order, and it felt like the supposedly heated pool wasnâ€™t at all heated. Outside around the pool area was messy, with dirty crockery, glassware and dirty towels lying around. Even the bathroom/change room facilities for the pool area were untidy, with dirty towels lying around. The shower cubical in the female change room was very dimly lit and thus posed a very serious risk of a possible slip or fall. If we had known that the advertised facilities were in such a state, we would have chosen to stay somewhere else. We did not make use of any of the room services or restaurants; however I hope that they are certainly not at a level anything like what the other services and facilities have been. Upon checking out, we also had an unpleasant experience, again having to wait a considerable time before being served (one staff member on duty). The female staff member was again very indifferent and didnâ€™t even care to ask whether we enjoyed our stay. Being a regular traveller to Sydney and frequent user of top hotels in the Sydney area, we have found that our experience at Stamford Sydney Airport left us feeling dissatisfied and displeased considering the fact that our expectations were not even that high. Simple customer service is not much to ask for as well as properly operating facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eldorado500
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous suite and wonderful service, great location, friendly staff, very tasty and good buffet dinner and breakfast. Will recommend and will be back...5 STARS *****

Reviews.Title: “Terrible terrible terrible”
Reviews.Author: cba81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it is close to the airport. This is something that I regret. I booked and paid for a room with an airport view, so keep that in mind while I go on. It took us 20 minutes to check in because they lost our booking. We got no help with our luggage. We went up to the 7th floor and I opened the room. The first thing that hit me was that the room was already occupied by someone else! Luckily they were not in there but their personal possesions, phones, laptop and everything were out, all for me to take if i was like that! The room didnt even over look the airport! I hailed down a porter and told them who didnt seem interested and told us to go back down to reception. We were given another room and I asked if it overlooked the airport and the answer I received was yes. Well when we got to the room it didnt, so I was lied to. I went back down to reception. Waited again and expressed my displeaseure. I said that I booked a room with airport views, the first one i got was someone elses room with no airport view, the second was empty but with no view and was lied to that it did have one! He then said that he will move us to a delux suite. I then went back to level 7 to get my wife, then to level 12. Opened the room and hey presto, it had a view of the airport. I dont know about delux suite, it was exactly the same as the other two rooms but with an airport view. The service here is terrible. How can you give out someone elses room! Even thought its close to the airport i wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you need to be close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: chrissyy71
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in November so that we could be close to the airport for an early morning flight. The staff at reception are wonderful. Very helpful, professional and accomodating. The room itself was OK, no major complaints, but a standard hotel room with reasonably good quality fittings. For our purposes for one night it was completely fine. The food in the hotel is a bit substandard. The menu didn't offer a great variety of choices and it seems the preferred option is the buffet, but if you are pregnant (like myself) then buffets aren't great. The food was overly expensive for what it was and the service at the restaurant was a little below expectation - when travelling with a child and giving a childrens menu it usually helps to advise if any of the listed options are not available PRIOR to leaving the menu. Of course our 3 year old was set on having pizza only to be told that they couldn't do it. This is not a big issue in itself but anyone who knows what it's like to manage the expectations of a tired 3 year old will know what I'm talking about!! Anyway my only other complaint was that the sheets were so OVERLY starched that they made a huge noise every time we moved in bed. This probably sounds bizarre but I've never come across this before and I spent the whole night trying not to move so that I didn't wake up my husband or daughter!! We got an excellent deal for the room on Wotif.com so for what we paid it was perfect. The location next to the airport was great and within easy reach for the shuttle bus which took literally a few mintues to get to the airport. The noise from the train and the airport was actually very minimal and our 3 yr old was very entertained by watching the planes landing and taking off. All in all if you need to stay next the airport this is an excellent option, just don't eat at the hotel and make sure you shop around for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Normal Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: THEPOW
Reviews.Content: OK if your staying overnight to catch a flight. For the price, you get an average room for this class. Front desk is helpful and business like. Fast transport to domestic and international terminals but $5 charge. We stayed in one of their "upgrade" rooms which included breakfast. By 8 am the buffet was cleaned out with several items missing, over 1/2 the tables in the dining room had yet to be bussed and the staff seemed to care less. There was also a charge for using one of their computers which could have been included in the higher "upgrade" room rate. Overall, it will do fine for just a night but have stayed at much better airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An expensive way to suit our purposes”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night before heading off O/S. I choose the hotel for its location - the closest to the Domestic Terminal - and cause it looked the nicest place to stay in the area. The room was your average hotel room - a decent size, reasonable fittings and furniture. Huge marble bathroom. Usual array of toiletries. everything was usual. the hotel was having a Malaysian Food Festival and the buffet was all themed - so we had that dinner and really enjoyed it. The one problem with this place - everything is expensive. The room was expensive, the dinner buffet, pay for the internet, and we used the valet parking option and that was $15 - all for your usual business hotel. The room is mostly insulated from the noise of the airport and surrounding roads and the freight train line - mostly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, just don't eat here”
Reviews.Author: Whitefern
Reviews.Content: If you need an overnight between internal or International flights this hotel is ideal. Great room, good rates, quiet, clean and convenient. A $5 transfer door to door from terminal to hotel runs every few minutes. BUT.. don't eat here or expect anything close to 'service'. We chose the buffet AUS$65 per head. It was dreadful, we complained that some dishes were not fresh, others were missing. The reply was uninterested and unwilling the compensate us. My advise is just to sleep here, don't eat.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Kay343
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times before. But this time we were let down, mainly by the staff. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. However the concierge staff seemed to not understand English and were also very unhelpful in trying to get us to the airport via there $5 shuttle (it use to free) that was fully booked and then via a taxi. We also found the service in the restaurant quite slow and when ordering a $16 hamburger we were told that it was pre cooked and couldn't be cooked to our liking. I would try one of the other airport hotels before returning to this one. The staff seemed very un-motivated and un-helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good views”
Reviews.Author: LouLouNsw
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very comfortable. We booked two king rooms with views over sydney airport which was very nice. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. The rooms were very clean. The parking is a bit of a nightmare. If you want the hotel to park it for you its $15 each time you need to use the car. Otherwise its $10 per night. Even though we had one car each of us were charged for parking per day. This became very costly over a few days. We ordered room service which was fresh and came to the room fast. Make sure you find the card on the bedside table to use the 20% off each meal in the hotel if you dont get your room made up every night. We didnt notice it till it was too late. We had the seafood buffet. Although it was nice I dont think it was worth the money. The prawns were a bit slimey and the crab had no flavour. I strongly suspect that everything was not as fresh as it should have been. The smoked salmon and salads were delicious. There was great variety of desserts. We tried many of them however some were stale and not very nice to eat. The service here was not very good at all. Overall we did enjoy this trip but then when we reviewed the bill at home we found that we had been charged for mini bar items we did not consume. This left a bad feeling so I guess I would try somewhere else in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lillysmum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight prior to leaving Sydney and we enjoyed our stay at the Stamford Plaza. We booked online through 'need it now' and secured a lovely room for $170...a BARGAIN for Sydney. The room was clean, well presented, quiet, and offered good facilities for the money. The guests next-door were a little noisy but this didn't go on for long. We ordered room service dinner and the service and food were both EXCELLENT. Checking in and out was smooth, efficient and we received very good service from desk staff. I would happily stay here again and would/will recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Wongaburra
Reviews.Content: Certainly close to Kingsford Smith Airport, offering a great view of the airport and quiet rooms. However the service, especially in the restaurant left a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but 3-star quality at best”
Reviews.Author: datahk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located. Just a couple of minutes drive from the domestic terminal. Less than 10mins from the international. Room size reasonable, comfortable and clean. Food selection and quality for breakfast is good. Service good. If you expect 4-5 star quality, you should go somewhere else. The hotel is ok - but everything about it, especially the bathroom, the lobby, the cafe, etc, shows it is ageing and seriously needs some upgrading done if it wants to advertise itself at least 4 stars. Unfortunately in the airport area, there are not many options. The $5 hotel transfer per way, although seems to be normal practice in Sydney, i think is ridiculous and should be part of the service.

Reviews.Title: “Was fine, especially for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: junodee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stamford Airport on 8/16. Our room was quiet, clean and the beds were comfortable. There was no airport noise. We used the gym and found that the outdoor pool was quite cool, but my child used it nevertheless. We ended up eating in the hotel restaurant because no other options existed. While the food was quite good, the service was slow and the servers seemed somewhat disinterested; the check was not accurate and it took some time for us to get the bill corrected. Beware of the hotel irons; I tried to iron a shirt and now have a dirty imprint on my shirt. We took the shuttle to the international terminal early in the morning and I can confirm the need to reserve space ahead of time. Overall, I would stay here again, but would not use the pool, irons and would order room service.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay- location to airport excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tas-wanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Stamford Plaza Sydney Airport in August 2008 for work reasons and I must admit after reading the latest Trip Advisor reviews it was with some fear and trepidation. I am happy to report that my stay was good. I caught the shuttle bus which was easy to find when walking out of the doors of Terminal 3. Bus driver seemed rather gruff and perhaps did not give the hotel guests a welcome which one would expect the hotel would want. Check in was very smooth and most impressive. Staff were most professional yet welcoming. The room was described as twin room with single beds and as you can see from the photos the beds were not really single. The room was very clean and tidy and the temperature was just right. Air conditioning was very quiet but effective. Beds were comfortable as were the pillowsâ€¦I slept very well. I ordered room service and the meal was excellent- Atlantic salmon with saladâ€¦.very nice. Breakfast was also excellent with no lack of food choices. Some of the concerns re noise from other rooms was not a problem for me and although there are many busy roads near the hotel (see photos) there were no more noise than one would expect from a large city. Few minor problems were a couple of the light globes did not work, mould in the bathroom between tiles needs some attention and some paintwork and furniture needs a touch upâ€¦.but these are minor niggles. Would I stay again? Yes I wouldâ€¦for convenience to the airport. The time to walk from the domestic airport is approximately 5 minutes which I did on the return journey although as there are many busy roads watch out for cars as some of the roads seemed to have no lights for pedestrians so one had to be quite wary!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: FlyJayClass
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Stamford Plaza while passing through Sydney enroute to Canada. I was given a complimentary upgrade to a 'Deluxe' room at check in which was nice. The room was large and quite comfortable the only complaint I have is that if you look close enough, everything is very worn. The carpet, the furniture, the wallpaper etc all looked as though it has seen better days. Internet use in the room is going for $30AUD which is ridiculous and the shuttle to the airport costs $5AUD each way! And make sure you book a seat in advance...I was in the lobby shortly after 7am only to be told all the spaces in the tiny hotel van were already booked!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport choice!”
Reviews.Author: Garota05
Reviews.Content: Great property if you're after something close by to the airport. I've stayed here quite a few times now, and if you stay here on a Sunday/Monday night the prices are usually lower than mid-week... The $5 shuttle service works perfectly and the rooms are quiet and comfortable. The windows are double-glazed and there is no airport noise at all... The bar downstairs serves great coffee and snacks (and ice-cream!) and the last time I was here, they let my family park in their car park for a few hours free of charge so we could have a proper goodbye before I left to live overseas. If you can get it for the right price, this is an excellent airport hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: lukeoz4
Reviews.Content: stayed at the stamford on sat 19.4.08 after dropping brother at airport, reception was friendly enough but room seems dated even after reno's and beds are hard and pillows terrible. the worst thing was the noise from the adjoining room which started at 12 at night till at least 3am rang reception and asked if they could do something about it which involved knocking on the door and being told by guests next door to [--] off and then giving up, was offered another room but as my 1 year old daughter had just gone to sleep after 2 hours of being kept awake by the noise i couldn't see the point i asked again for them to do something about the noise and the rang them and no change, i rang again at 3 in the morning to be told there was nothing they could do about it and to see the duty manager in the morning. next morning at check out after no sleep i asked for the duty manager and told him my concerns, his reply was to offer free parking at a value of 10 dollars, i laughed as i thought he was joking after paying good money for no sleep he said the best he could offer was 2 free breakfast in there restaraunt which is about what soggy cold bacon and sloppy eggs are worth. for anyone wanting to stay at a decent hotel at the airport pick the holiday inn at least you might get a nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: RexT
Reviews.Content: First rate hotel, very close to airport; perfect for a one-night stay awaiting flight home. Large room with desk, sofa, king bed -- best bed of the 9 hotels I recently stayed at in AU. Excellent staff, very professional. There is nothing within walking distance worth checking out (e.g. bars or restaurants) so one is pretty much confined to premises. Also, there is a charge for the airport shuttle, which I thought was ludicrous. Internet was very expensive. With these exceptions, we were very pleased.

HotelInfo.Name: Stamford Plaza Sydney Airport
HotelInfo.Address: Corner O'Riordan & Robey Streets, Sydney, New South Wales 2020, Australia
